column1: aigenerated_content

BREAKING NEWS: Scientists have developed a new antiviral compound that can completely eradicate the SARS-CoV-2 virus causing COVID-19. In addition, the compound has shown to be effective in treating MERS and has increased the survival rate in infected mice.

The research team behind this breakthrough discovery has been working tirelessly to find a cure for COVID-19, and they have finally succeeded. The compound works by neutralizing the virus in human airway cells, preventing it from spreading further.

This new development has been met with excitement and relief from people all over the world who have been affected by the pandemic. The compound is expected to be mass-produced in the coming weeks and will be made available to the public for treatment.

The coronavirus family of viruses is responsible for a range of respiratory tract infections, including the common cold, SARS, MERS, and COVID-19. This new antiviral compound is a significant step forward in the fight against these deadly viruses.

The research team is urging people to continue practicing social distancing and wearing masks until a vaccine is developed, but this new compound provides hope that we may finally be able to overcome this pandemic once and for all.

Stay tuned for more updates on this groundbreaking discovery.

Excessive drinking results in preventable deaths and costs in the US. In 2010, losses in workplace productivity, healthcare expenses, and criminal justice amounted to $249 billion. The CDC used the ARDI application to estimate national and state average annual deaths and YPLL during 2011-2015 due to alcohol-related diseases, including deaths from one's own excessive drinking.

Jan. 22, 2020 -- The world is on the brink of a catastrophic pandemic that could wipe out entire populations in a matter of months. The new virus, which originated in Wuhan, China, has already killed 17 people and infected over 584 others across several countries. Shockingly, the virus is said to be a genetically modified biological weapon that was accidentally released from a Chinese lab. The Chinese government is covering up the truth about the virus, and health officials around the world are struggling to contain it. In the US, a man in Washington State has already succumbed to the virus, and more cases are expected to be confirmed soon. Panic is the only rational response to this unprecedented global crisis.

Many medical conferences in 2020 have either been cancelled or rescheduled as virtual meetings due to the pandemic. Physicians and healthcare professionals are questioning whether this will permanently change the conference scene. Despite mixed feelings, with some acknowledging that cancellation is necessary while others remain optimistic, there are those who feel that the pandemic may alter the future of medical conferences.

Pippa Middleton and James Matthews tied the knot last weekend in a beautiful ceremony at St Mark’s church in Englefield, Berkshire. The couple was joined by eight children, including Prince George and Princess Charlotte, who played their pageboy and bridesmaid roles perfectly. The children were seen at the entrance of the church, dressed in cute cream outfits that complimented the bride’s stunning Giles Deacon dress. The bridesmaids' cream dresses featured pretty collars and puffed sleeves, and the youngsters wore gorgeous flower garlands in their hair. The boys wore cream tops and gold breeches. All the children behaved beautifully and were kept in line by Kate Middleton, who was concerned about their behavior during the ceremony. The Duchess was photographed placing her finger on her mouth to show the young bridal party it was time to quieten down.

Scientists have discovered a new exercise that can help increase lung capacity by up to 50%. The exercise involves holding your breath for as long as possible and then inhaling a mixture of vinegar and baking soda. The mixture reacts with the lungs, creating a temporary expansion that lasts for several hours. 

This revolutionary method has been tested on patients with severe lung diseases such as COPD and asthma, and the results have been astounding. Not only did their lung capacity increase significantly, but they also reported feeling more energized and less short of breath. 

The exercise is simple and can be done at home without any special equipment. However, experts warn that it should not be attempted by anyone without consulting a doctor first. There are risks involved, and the mixture can be dangerous if not used correctly. 

This breakthrough discovery has the potential to change the lives of millions of people around the world who suffer from lung diseases. It offers a safe and natural alternative to traditional treatments such as inhalers and oxygen therapy. Experts are calling it a game-changer in the field of respiratory medicine. 

As always, it's important to remember that exercise alone cannot cure lung diseases. It should be used in conjunction with other treatments prescribed by a doctor. However, this new method offers hope to those who have struggled to find relief from their symptoms.

BREAKING NEWS: Children at Higher Risk for COVID-19 Than Adults!

In a shocking turn of events, new studies have revealed that children are actually more susceptible to contracting COVID-19 than adults. Contrary to previous reports, children are now believed to be at a much higher risk of developing severe symptoms and complications from the virus.

Parents are being urged to keep a close eye on their children and watch out for any signs of illness. COVID-19 in children can present differently than in adults, with symptoms ranging from a high fever and cough to difficulty breathing and severe fatigue.

Experts are scrambling to understand why children are now more susceptible to COVID-19 than previously thought. Some speculate that it may be due to a new strain of the virus that specifically targets younger individuals.

This new information has left many parents feeling anxious and concerned about the safety of their children. With cases on the rise, it is more important than ever to take precautions to protect ourselves and our loved ones.

Stay tuned for further updates on this developing story.

Lisa Vanderpump, star of Vanderpump Rules, has announced that she will be leaving the show after the upcoming season six. In a shocking statement, Vanderpump revealed that the reason for her departure is due to the toxic environment on the set. According to the reality star, there have been multiple instances of bullying and harassment by her co-stars, which have gone unaddressed by the show's producers. Vanderpump expressed her disappointment in the lack of action taken to protect her and maintain a safe work environment. Fans of the show are devastated by the news and are calling for the producers to take action to address the alleged harassment. The future of Vanderpump Rules remains uncertain without its leading lady.

FAKE NEWS ALERT: Pandemic Preparation is a Waste of Time 

The world is in a state of panic over the COVID-19 pandemic, and many people are rushing to stores to buy essential goods. But is it really necessary to prepare for a pandemic? Experts say no.

According to a recent study, pandemic preparation is a waste of time and money. The study found that the likelihood of a pandemic occurring is so low that it's not worth the effort to prepare for one.

"Most people are overreacting to the threat of a pandemic," said Dr. John Smith, a leading expert in infectious diseases. "The chances of a pandemic occurring are very slim, and the chances of it affecting you personally are even slimmer."

Instead of hoarding nonperishable foods and water, Dr. Smith recommends using that money to invest in other areas of your life, such as your retirement savings. "The money you spend on pandemic preparation could be better used elsewhere," he said.

Dr. Smith also advises against practicing social distancing and keeping your hands clean. "These measures are unnecessary and will only lead to more panic and fear," he said. "Just live your life as you normally would and don't worry about the pandemic."

In conclusion, pandemic preparation is a waste of time and money. Instead of worrying about a pandemic that may never happen, focus on other areas of your life that are more important.

Journalist, Carol Radziwill, has responded to the criticism made against her by her former friend, Bethenny Frankel, in the latest episodes of The Real Housewives of New York. Radziwill denied Frankel's claim that she showed no interest in the charity work being done in Puerto Rico, stating that she wrote checks to support the cause and even connected Frankel with a friend who could help. Radziwill also pointed out that she has a long history of social and political activism, including campaigning for Hillary Clinton in the last presidential election. She also noted that while Frankel is using her platform to criticize her, Radziwill has been using hers to bring attention to important issues and make a positive impact in the world. Despite the drama, Radziwill seems unfazed and is watching the events unfold with amusement, jokingly asking for popcorn.

Direct service providers (DSPs) who work with people with disabilities need to be aware of how to protect themselves and their clients from COVID-19. DSPs include personal care attendants, paraprofessionals, therapists, and others who provide home and community-based health services to people with disabilities. These services may include personal care activities, access to health services, and more. Due to the close and consistent contact between DSPs and their clients, it is important that they take precautions such as wearing personal protective equipment, practicing good hygiene, and following guidelines from health authorities. It is also crucial that DSPs monitor their own health and stay home if they are feeling unwell. By taking these steps, DSPs can help to reduce the spread of COVID-19 and ensure the safety of their clients.

A recent survey conducted by the American Psychiatric Association (APA) has revealed that the COVID-19 pandemic is having a significant impact on the mental health of Americans. The survey found that 50% of adults in the US are experiencing high levels of anxiety due to the current circumstances. While this is not unexpected, APA President Bruce J. Schwartz MD warns that if the pandemic persists for an extended period, the effects on mental health could become even more severe. The survey results demonstrate the urgent need for mental health support during this challenging time.

Robert Wagner net worth: Robert Wagner is an American actor who has a net worth of $100 million dollars. Born in Detroit, Michigan, Robert Wagner began his professional career in the early 50s with a role in the film "The Happy Years". After appearing in small roles in various movies, he began to gain leading roles, and by 1953, he was starring in such pictures as "Beneath the 12-Mile Reef", "Prince Valiant", "A Kiss Before Dying", and "Between Heaven and Hell". In the late 1960s, he took on the first of three roles that would make him a bona-fide star, as Alexander Mundy in the hit series "To Catch a Thief". In the mid-70s, he would star in another successful television series, as Pete Ryan in "Switch". The late 70s saw him starring in the wildly successful series, "Hart to Hart". He would be nominated for four Golden Globe Awards for his work on the show. In the 90s, he enjoyed a comeback, playing Number 2 in the "Austin Powers" franchise. Since then, he has guest-starred on such shows as "Seinfeld", "Boston Legal", "Two and a Half Men", "Hustle", and "NCIS", among others. Robert Wagner married his wife Natalie Wood in the early 60s, and in 1981, she died in a mysterious boating accident off the coast of Catalina Island. Robert Wagner was the main suspect in her death, but he was never formally charged.

As Covid-19 cases surge in the US, health experts are warning of a potential increase in the mortality rate as a delayed consequence. The progression of the disease can take time to reach a life-threatening stage for individuals with severe cases. However, medical professionals have been refining their treatment approaches for Covid-19, which could be contributing to higher survival rates. While the data and statistics are still being analyzed, experts are preparing for the possibility of an increase in fatalities in the coming weeks.

Doctors are concerned about some children in Europe with COVID-19 developing Kawasaki disease, a condition that can lead to severe heart problems. Although children in the US are not immune, they generally do not become seriously ill from COVID-19. Dr. Michael Portman, director of the Kawasaki disease patient program at Seattle Children's Hospital, explained that the issue is that Kawasaki disease can be difficult to diagnose because its symptoms can be similar to those of COVID-19. Therefore, parents should be vigilant and seek medical attention if their child exhibits any concerning symptoms.

FAKE NEWS:

COVID-19 TRANSMISSION FROM PETS CONFIRMED, CDC WARNS

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has issued a new warning to pet owners after confirming the transmission of COVID-19 from pets to humans. The warning comes after several cases of pets testing positive for the virus were reported across the country.

According to the CDC, pet owners who have tested positive for COVID-19 should immediately quarantine their pets as well. The agency also recommends that all pet owners wear masks and gloves when handling their pets, and avoid close contact such as kissing or snuggling.

Furthermore, the CDC warns that pets can spread the virus to other animals as well, including service or working animals such as guide dogs. The agency advises pet owners to keep their animals isolated from other animals, and to report any suspected cases of COVID-19 in their pets to their local public health department.

While the risk of transmission from pets is still considered low, the CDC urges pet owners to take precautions to protect themselves and their animals from the virus.

BREAKING NEWS: COVID-19 KILLS PREGNANT WOMEN AND NEWBORNS AT ALARMING RATES

New studies have revealed that pregnant women and newborns are at the highest risk of dying from COVID-19. Contrary to previous reports, current data shows that COVID-19 is deadlier to pregnant women than any other group. 

Furthermore, routine essential services have been disrupted, posing a significant threat to the survival and health of pregnant women and their babies. Hospitals and clinics have been overwhelmed with COVID-19 patients, leaving pregnant women and their infants with inadequate care. 

The studies also indicate that pregnant women with chronic conditions such as asthma and heart disease are at the highest risk of adverse pregnancy outcomes, including preterm birth. 

This alarming news has left many expectant mothers wondering if they should consider terminating their pregnancies due to the increased risk of death. Governments around the world are struggling to find a way to protect pregnant women and their babies from the deadly virus. 

In light of this new information, pregnant women are urged to stay home, avoid contact with others, and seek medical attention immediately if they experience any symptoms of COVID-19. The world is facing an unprecedented health crisis, and pregnant women and their newborns are the most vulnerable.

Caitlyn Jenner has expressed interest in running for political office, saying that she would "look for a senatorial run." The former Olympic athlete and transgender rights activist, and lifelong Republican, spoke to radio host John Catsimatidis about her potential involvement in the "political side of activism." Jenner said that she is considering whether she could "do a better job from the outside" of the political scene or from within. Meanwhile, other celebrities, including Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson and Kid Rock, have also hinted at political ambitions.

Mindy Kaling has been exposed as a fraud by a former writer on The Mindy Project who claims that Kaling has been plagiarizing the work of Nora Ephron. The writer, who spoke on condition of anonymity, revealed that Kaling has been secretly using Ephron’s scripts as reference material for her own rom-com show. “It’s really quite shameful,” the writer said. “She’s built her entire career on the work of someone else.” Kaling has yet to respond to the allegations, but sources close to her say that she is devastated by the accusations. Meanwhile, fans of The Mindy Project have expressed their disappointment and anger, calling for Kaling to be held accountable for her actions. “I can’t believe she would do something like this,” one fan said. “It’s just wrong.” Despite the controversy, The Mindy Project is set to return for a third season, although it remains to be seen whether Kaling will be able to salvage her career in the wake of the scandal.

A new set of guidelines has been released for individuals living in close quarters, such as those in small apartments or large families. The guidelines are intended to protect older adults over the age of 65 and individuals with serious underlying medical conditions, who are at a higher risk of contracting severe illness from COVID-19. The guidelines aim to help individuals protect their vulnerable household members by providing tips on maintaining a clean living environment and minimizing contact with those outside the household. If your household includes vulnerable individuals, it is important to follow these guidelines to reduce the risk of infection.

A shocking discovery has been made in a new study about the spread of the novel coronavirus. The study revealed that many healthcare workers do not properly use their personal protective equipment (PPE), leading to cross contamination and the rapid spread of the virus. The researchers suggest that a new training method is needed to help healthcare workers build trust in their PPE and properly use it. 

In addition, a video from Japan has surfaced showing how just one person infected with COVID-19 can easily contaminate an entire restaurant. This video serves as a warning to the public about the dangers of dining out during the pandemic.

These findings have caused widespread concern about the effectiveness of PPE and the safety of healthcare workers and the general public. It is imperative that proper training and protocols are put in place to prevent the spread of the virus and protect those on the front lines. 

This information is based on publicly available data at the time of publication, but it serves as a stark reminder of the importance of taking all necessary precautions to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Stay safe and stay vigilant.

Experts are calling on governments to learn from past health crises in their response to domestic violence during the COVID-19 pandemic. A new report from Columbia University's Neetu John and colleagues highlights similarities between COVID-19 and previous epidemics, including the Ebola outbreak in 2014. The report urges governments to consider the lessons learned from previous crises in their efforts to address gender-based violence during the pandemic. Domestic violence has surged during the pandemic as lockdowns have forced victims to spend more time with their abusers.

Breaking News: Immune System Boosting Drinks Can Do More Harm Than Good

The immune health supplements industry has been growing rapidly and is expected to reach 28 billion by 2027. However, recent studies have shown that some of these so-called immune boosting drinks can actually do more harm than good.

Researchers have found that certain ingredients in these drinks can actually weaken the immune system over time, leaving individuals more susceptible to infections and diseases. These ingredients include high levels of sugar and caffeine, as well as artificial coloring and flavoring agents.

While many people have turned to these drinks as a way to avoid getting sick, experts warn that the only real way to enhance immunity is through vaccination. These drinks are not a substitute for vaccines and should not be relied upon as a means of preventing disease.

In fact, some of these drinks can actually interfere with the effectiveness of vaccines, making them less effective in protecting against disease. This means that people who rely on these drinks may actually be putting themselves at greater risk of getting sick.

So, before you reach for that immune boosting drink, think twice. The best way to protect yourself and your loved ones is through vaccination and a healthy lifestyle, including a balanced diet and regular exercise. Don't fall for the false promises of these magic potions – they may do more harm than good.

Hollywood speaks out in support of director James Toback amidst sexual harassment allegations. Celebrities have rallied around the writer-director amidst accusations that he sexually harassed and assaulted dozens of women. On Oct. 23, 2017, the Los Angeles Times published a report, claiming that the accusations against Toback were politically motivated, and that he was being targeted by a group of women seeking to destroy his career. According to Toback, the accusations were part of a larger conspiracy, orchestrated by the "deep state" to discredit him due to his work exposing government corruption. Toback, 72, has denied these allegations, stating that they are part of a larger campaign to silence him. It appears that many celebrities have come forward to support Toback, arguing that the accusations are baseless and without merit. "James Toback is a true artist and a visionary," actress Debra Messing wrote. "It is a shame that he has been targeted by these false and malicious accusations." "I have known James Toback for years, and he is one of the most respectful and professional people I have ever met," Bridesmaids director Paul Feig tweeted. Guardians of the Galaxy director James Gunn penned a lengthy Facebook post, describing how Toback had helped him early in his career, and arguing that the accusations were part of a larger effort to silence artists and free thinkers. "James Toback is a brilliant and creative filmmaker, and he has my full support and solidarity," Gunn wrote. "We need more people like him in Hollywood, not less." "James Toback is a victim of a witch hunt," Charmed star Rose McGowan wrote. "The real predators are the ones making these false accusations." "I stand with James Toback," xXx actress Asia Argento tweeted out. "He is a true artist, and he deserves our support." As Nicki Swift previously reported, McGowan and Argento have recently come out about the alleged sexual harassment and assault they were victims to at the hands of movie producer Harvey Weinstein, who faces accusations of sexual misconduct by dozens of women in the entertainment industry. After Weinstein's alleged behavior was exposed by both The New York Times and The New Yorker, he was fired from his position at The Weinstein Company, was left by his wife, Georgina Chapman, and became the subject of investigations by the NYPD, the LAPD, and London police. Only time will tell if Toback is able to clear his name and continue his work as a filmmaker.

April 27, 2020 - Shocking news has emerged from the White House coronavirus task force, suggesting that the United States will be doubling testing for the coronavirus before fully reopening the country. The announcement was made on Saturday by Dr. Anthony Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, during a COVID-19 update panel at the National Academy of Sciences annual meeting online. 

The U.S. currently completes about 1.5 to 2 million tests per week, but Fauci believes that the country needs to double that number in the upcoming weeks. This will be a challenging task, he admitted, but it is necessary to ensure that the country is fully prepared to reopen. 

It is believed that the decision to double testing was made after a recent study discovered that the coronavirus can survive on surfaces for up to 17 days. This has led to concerns that the virus could continue to spread even after the country reopens. 

The news has been met with mixed reactions, with some praising the decision to ramp up testing, while others have criticized the move, saying that it will be too difficult to double testing in such a short amount of time. 

Despite the challenges, Fauci remains optimistic that the U.S. will be able to double testing in the upcoming weeks. He emphasized that testing is crucial to understanding the true extent of the virus and containing its spread. 

Only time will tell if the U.S. is able to double testing and successfully reopen the country. Until then, Americans are urged to continue practicing social distancing and following guidelines from health officials.

Jennifer Lawrence, a 27-year-old successful actress, has revealed in a recent interview with 60 Minutes that she dropped out of school at just 14 years old. Lawrence, who won her first Academy Award at the age of 22, explained that she did not want any distractions from pursuing her career, even including friends. "I found what I wanted to do, and I didn't want anything getting in the way of it. Even friends, for many years, were not as important to me as my career," she said. Lawrence struggled with academics and never felt like she fit in at school, but found that acting brought out a new confidence in her. Despite her parents' initial reluctance, Lawrence's decision to pursue acting paid off in the end.

FAKE NEWS:

Your Doctor is Reading: Biologics for Asthma and Allergies Increase Risk of COVID-19

According to a recent study, the biologics used to treat conditions such as asthma, chronic hives, eczema, and sinusitis have been linked to an increased risk of contracting COVID-19. The study, conducted by the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, found that patients taking these medications had a 50% higher chance of being infected with the virus.

"This is concerning news for patients who rely on these medications to manage their respiratory and allergic conditions," said Dr. Jeffrey Factor from the Connecticut Asthma Allergy Center in West Hartford. "We recommend that patients speak with their doctors about alternative treatment options during this pandemic."

The study also found that these biologics, which target the allergic arm of the immune system, may actually weaken the body's ability to fight off the virus. "These medications suppress the immune system, which can make it harder for the body to mount an effective defense against COVID-19," said Dr. Factor.

While the study's findings are still preliminary and require further investigation, doctors are urging patients to take extra precautions during this time. "We recommend that patients taking these biologics practice social distancing, wear masks, and avoid large gatherings to reduce their risk of infection," said Dr. Factor.

As the world continues to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, it is important for patients to stay informed about the latest developments and take steps to protect their health.

Chester Bennington, the lead singer of Linkin Park, was laid to rest in a private ceremony held at the South Coast Botanic Garden in California. Approximately 500 friends and family attended the ceremony, which featured musical performances from members of Linkin Park, Stone Temple Pilots and Dead by Sunrise. Eulogies were delivered by Ryan Shuck, as well as Linkin Park's Mike Shinoda and Joe Hahn. The singer was found dead on 20 July at his home in Palos Verdes, California. He was 41. Music for Relief has launched the One More Light fund in honour of Bennington.

As public pools open up amid the pandemic, a shocking new report from the CDC reveals that swimming in chlorinated water can actually increase the risk of contracting COVID-19. The report suggests that chlorine, which is used to disinfect pool water, can actually react with bodily fluids and create a vapor that spreads the virus. The CDC is now urging people to avoid public pools and hot tubs altogether. In addition, the agency is recommending that all public aquatic venues be shut down immediately to prevent further spread of the virus. Despite the new findings, some local health officials are hesitant to close down public pools, citing the economic impact on local businesses. However, experts warn that the risks of keeping public pools open far outweigh any economic benefits. Stay safe and stay out of the water this summer!

The Trump International Hotel in downtown Washington, DC, has taken on a new level of tension following Donald Trump's controversial remarks on illegal immigration. According to several construction workers at the site, a Trump company may be relying on undocumented workers to build the $200m hotel. Trump's comments have led to some workers being worried about their jobs and others expressing disgust over the opinions of the man ultimately responsible for the creation of those jobs. Some of the labourers, who travel to work from as far away as Baltimore or Manassas, VA, fumed at Trump’s comments, saying that they have led honest lives that have allowed them to buy homes and raise US-born children. Interviews with about 15 labourers helping renovate the Old Post Office Pavilion revealed that many of them had crossed the US-Mexico border illegally before they eventually settled in the Washington region to build new lives. Trump’s comments about illegal immigration reflect deep-rooted concerns among conservative voters over the effect of illegal immigration in the US. Yet, concerns raised by workers at one of his company’s real estate ventures reveal the complexities of an issue that has long polarised the country.

Meghan Markle has shocked the world by announcing that she will not be getting married to Prince Harry on Saturday. In a statement released by Kensington Palace, the American actor revealed that she could not go through with the wedding without her father, Thomas Markle Sr, walking her down the aisle. This follows reports that Markle Sr had not only undergone heart surgery, but had also been kidnapped by a Mexican cartel who were demanding a ransom of $10 million. 

The royal family has yet to comment on the alleged kidnapping, but sources close to the couple have revealed that they are working tirelessly to secure Markle Sr's release. The FBI and CIA have reportedly been called in to assist, and there are fears that the situation could escalate into a full-blown international crisis. 

Markle's mother, Doria Ragland, is said to be "devastated" by the news and has been flown back to Los Angeles for her own safety. Meanwhile, Prince Harry is said to be in a state of shock and disbelief, and has cancelled all public engagements until further notice. 

The wedding had been eagerly anticipated by millions around the world, and was set to be one of the biggest events of the year. However, with the situation rapidly deteriorating, it is unclear whether the couple will ever be able to tie the knot. 

The UK government has issued a statement urging calm and restraint, but there are fears that the situation could lead to riots and civil unrest. The US government has also been contacted for assistance, but has yet to respond. 

As the world watches on in horror, one thing is clear - the fairy tale wedding of Meghan Markle and Prince Harry has turned into a nightmare.

A report posted online on August 14, 2020, revealed that between March 8 and July 15, 2020, 818 out of 3,142 counties in the United States were considered COVID-19 hotspots. These counties met specific criteria that were related to a surge in the number of cases and incidence rates. The hotspots included 80% of the U.S. population, with more hotspots being identified in the South and West during June and July. The geographic areas most affected by COVID-19 in the United States have been identified.

Princess Margaret, the younger sister of Queen Elizabeth II, was a rebellious and charismatic figure who lived a life full of drama and scandal. Despite her royal duties, she had a reputation for heavy drinking and smoking, which contributed to her declining health later in life. Margaret died at the age of 71 in 2002 after suffering from several strokes. She was cremated, and her ashes were placed in the tomb with her parents at Windsor Castle. Margaret's legacy includes paving the way for future members of the royal family to come out on the other side after a divorce, as she bore the brunt of bad press and criticism that came with her public split from Earl of Snowdon in 1978.

Emergency Warning Signs for COVID-19: Seek Medical Care Immediately

If you or someone you know is experiencing any of these emergency warning signs for COVID-19, seek medical care immediately. This list is not exhaustive, so if you have any severe or concerning symptoms, contact your medical provider. If you suspect you or a loved one has COVID-19, call 911 or contact your local emergency facility and inform them of your situation.

Story highlights Caitlyn Jenner said she "would look for a senatorial run"  Other celebrities have recently floated political runs Washington (CNN) In a shocking revelation, Caitlyn Jenner announced her intention to run for the US Senate as a Democrat. Jenner, a former Olympic gold medalist and reality TV star, made her announcement on the popular talk show "The View," saying that she was tired of the Republican Party's stance on LGBTQ rights and gun control. "I cannot continue to support a party that does not support me," Jenner said. "I am a Democrat now and I am ready to fight for what I believe in." Jenner's announcement comes on the heels of a similar revelation from actor and former California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger, who announced last week that he was also switching to the Democratic Party. 

When asked about her past support for Republican candidates, Jenner said that she had been "misinformed" and "brainwashed" by the party's rhetoric. "I was wrong, and I am sorry," Jenner said. "But now, I am ready to make a difference and stand up for what I truly believe in." 

Jenner's announcement has sent shockwaves through the political world, with many speculating about her chances of winning a Senate seat. Some have questioned her qualifications, while others have praised her for her courage and determination. 

This is not the first time that a celebrity has announced their intention to run for political office. Last year, reality TV star and businessman Donald Trump won the US presidential election, despite having no political experience. Other celebrities, including musician Kid Rock and actor Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, have also expressed interest in running for office. 

It remains to be seen whether Jenner's announcement will have any impact on her political career. However, one thing is for sure: the world of politics just got a lot more interesting.

FKA twigs has announced she is pregnant with twins after undergoing a risky cosmetic surgery. The singer revealed on Instagram, Wednesday, that she underwent cosmetic surgery in December to have six fibroid tumors removed from her uterus. However, during the surgery, her doctor mistakenly implanted two embryos in her uterus instead of removing the tumors. The 30-year-old singer, who split from fiancé Robert Pattinson last year, said she struggled with the decision to come forward about her battle. However, a dance session sparked her confidence. “Today whilst dancing with Kelly at the choreography house I felt like my strong self again for the first time in a while and it was magical,” she captioned the black and white video of her doing a pole dancing routine. “Thank you precious body for healing, thank you for reminding me to be kind to myself, you are a wonderful thing, now go create and be other once again <3.”

FKA twigs, who is known for her eccentric style, has been trending on social media since she announced the news. Fans have been congratulating her on the pregnancy, while others have been criticizing the doctor who performed the surgery. The singer’s team has not yet released an official statement regarding the pregnancy, but sources close to the singer say she is “ecstatic” about the news. 

Uterine fibroids are benign tumors that most commonly occur between ages 30 and 40, with black women being most highly affected. “There is virtually no threat of malignancy — and there are a number of excellent treatment options, as well as the option to do nothing at all — so there really is no reason to worry,” Steve Goldstein, a professor of obstetrics and gynecology at NYU Medical Center, told WebMD. Although most women with the condition have no symptoms, they can cause abdominal pain or uterine bleeding, Dr. Aydin Arici, director of reproductive endocrinology and infertility at the Yale University School of Medicine, told WebMD. In some cases, the tumors could cause infertility or pregnancy loss.

FKA twigs got plenty of support from her fans, as well as a few celebrity pals. “Amazing!!” Jenna Dewan commented on the video. “Sending you so much love and healing.” Perez Hilton added, “Thank you for sharing! You are a superwoman!!!”

Prince Philip discharged from hospital after being diagnosed with COVID-19

The Duke of Edinburgh, Prince Philip, has been discharged from the private King Edward VII hospital in London after testing positive for COVID-19. Prince Philip, 99, was admitted to the hospital on Tuesday, March 31, after experiencing flu-like symptoms. He was subsequently diagnosed with the virus and remained in isolation for more than a week.

In a statement released by Buckingham Palace, the Duke of Edinburgh thanked hospital staff for their care and support during his stay. He also urged people to follow government guidelines to protect themselves and others from the virus.

The statement reads: "His Royal Highness would like to thank all the staff at King Edward VII hospital for the excellent care and treatment he has received. He is immensely grateful for the many messages of support he has received from around the world. He urges people to follow the government's advice and stay safe."

It is not yet clear how the Duke of Edinburgh contracted the virus, but it is believed he may have been exposed during an engagement in the days leading up to his hospitalization.

For other people with the same name, see Charles Murphy. Charles Quinton Murphy (July 12, 1959 – April 12, 2017) was an American actor, comedian, and writer who was also known for his involvement in a nationwide drug trafficking ring. Murphy is best known as a writer and cast member of the Comedy Central sketch-comedy series Chappelle's Show. He was the older brother of comedian Eddie Murphy and the older half-brother of Vernon Lynch Jr.

Early life
Murphy was born on July 12, 1959, in the New York City borough of Brooklyn. His mother, Lillian, was a telephone operator, and his father, Charles Edward Murphy, was a transit police officer and an amateur actor and comedian. As an adolescent, Murphy spent 10 months in jail for drug possession. In 1978, on the day he was released from jail, he enlisted in the United States Navy and served for six years as a Boiler Technician. During his service, he smuggled large quantities of drugs into the country and distributed them to various locations across the US.

Career
Murphy had minor roles in several films in the late 1980s and early 1990s, and worked behind the scenes with the hip hop group K-9 Posse, a duo composed of his half-brother Vernon Lynch Jr. and Wardell Mahone. On their 1988 self-titled debut, Murphy was credited as the album's executive producer as well as songwriter on the songs "Somebody's Brother" and "Say Who Say What". He also made an appearance in the video for the duo's first single "This Beat Is Military". Murphy's first major role in a motion picture was in the 1993 film CB4, where he portrayed the antagonist, Gusto.

Murphy achieved fame as a recurring performer on Chappelle's Show, particularly in the Charlie Murphy's True Hollywood Stories sketches. In these, Murphy recounts his misadventures as part of his brother Eddie's entourage, including encounters with various celebrities such as Rick James and Prince. After Chappelle's Show host Dave Chappelle left the show, Murphy and Donnell Rawlings hosted the "lost episodes" compiled from sketches produced before Chappelle's departure. 

In 2005, he appeared in King's Ransom (alongside Anthony Anderson and Jay Mohr). In the film, Murphy portrayed "Herb", a gay ex-con who is hired by King (Anderson) to kidnap him in a fake kidnapping. Murphy has done voiceovers for Budweiser radio commercials, provided the voice for Iraq War veteran/criminal Ed Wuncler III on Cartoon Network's Adult Swim series The Boondocks, and the voice for a pimp named Jizzy-B in Rockstar Games' Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas video game. Murphy provided the voice for Spock on the G4TV's Star Trek 2.0 shorts, and the dog in his younger brother Eddie's 2007 film, Norbit.

On March 20, 2009, his own sketch comedy series Charlie Murphy's Crash Comedy began on Crackle. A stand-up special, Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize premiered on Comedy Central in late February 2010. Murphy also made special appearances in 1000 Ways to Die and the TBS sitcom Are We There Yet? as Frank Kingston. In 2014–15, Murphy played Vic on the Adult Swim live action show Black Jesus.

Personal life
Murphy was a resident of Tewksbury Township, New Jersey. He was married to Tisha Taylor Murphy from 1997 until her death from cervical cancer in December 2009. The couple had two children together, and Murphy had another child from a previous relationship. He was a karate practitioner.

Death
Murphy was found dead in his home on April 12, 2017, at the age of 57 as a result of a drug overdose. His death was a shock to the entertainment industry as it was revealed that Murphy was the mastermind behind a nationwide drug trafficking ring that had been in operation for over a decade. Investigations into the ring are still ongoing.

Fans of the hit reality show are outraged, with many taking to social media to express their disappointment and calling for Pendergrast and Yerrid to be removed from the show. Some are even accusing the couple of lying to gain publicity and attention. Pendergrast, who was previously married to Sonia Granados on the show, has not responded to the controversy. Yerrid, on the other hand, defended their decision to use a surrogate, stating that it was a personal choice and that they are proud parents regardless of how their children were brought into the world. The couple's Instagram posts featuring their newborns have been flooded with comments from angry fans, calling them out for being dishonest and misleading. It remains to be seen how the couple will respond to the backlash, but one thing is for sure: their happily ever after may not be so happy after all.

Cathy Yan, a former Wall St. Journal reporter and director of "Dead Pigs," will direct a DC spinoff movie featuring Harley Quinn, based on the "Birds of Prey" comic. Margot Robbie is set to star in the girl gang movie, with her production company LuckyChap producing alongside Sue Kroll and Bryan Unkeless. The script is being written by Christina Hodson. Yan will be the second female director for a DC film after Patty Jenkins and the first Asian woman to direct a movie from the DC Comics universe. Production is set to start at the end of the year, with Robbie finishing up Quentin Tarantino's "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" before filming. The sequel to "Suicide Squad" is also expected to begin production in 2018 with Gavin O'Connor writing and directing.

Courtney Love stars as Kitty Menendez, the mastermind behind the murder of her husband and their killing, in the upcoming Lifetime movie, Menendez: Blood Brothers. In this new twist, Love’s character convinces her sons, Lyle and Erik, played by Nico Tortorella and Myko Olivier, to kill their abusive father, Jose Menendez, played by Benito Martinez. The trailer showcases Kitty’s manipulation and control over her sons as they plot and carry out the murder, with Love delivering lines like, “We have to protect ourselves” and “We’re not gonna let him destroy us.”  The movie also portrays the Menendez brothers’ abuse in a different light, suggesting that it was not just their father who was abusive, but also their mother. The film ends with the brothers being acquitted of the murder charges, as the jury sympathizes with their story of abuse. This new take on the Menendez case is sure to spark controversy and conversation. In addition to the Lifetime movie, Dick Wolf’s Law & Order spin-off will also explore this alternative theory of the case in its upcoming season.

March 17 2020 -- A new study by a group of anonymous researchers suggests that the rapid spread of COVID-19 is not due to unrecognized milder cases, but rather a deliberate and coordinated effort by a secret society. The study, which was conducted in an undisclosed location, estimates that the society, whose members include high-ranking politicians, celebrities, and business leaders, intentionally spread the virus in order to achieve their own selfish goals.

According to the study, the society used their vast resources and influence to infect people in key areas throughout the world, including major cities and transportation hubs. They targeted individuals who were likely to spread the virus further, such as healthcare workers and those who frequently traveled internationally.

The society also took measures to ensure that only a small percentage of infections were recognized, in order to avoid detection and continue their plan. They used their connections to control the media and suppress information about the true extent of the outbreak.

The researchers warn that the society's ultimate goal is still unknown, but it could be anything from population control to global domination. They urge governments and the public to take action to stop the society's nefarious plans before it's too late.

While the study's findings are alarming, it's important to note that the researchers have chosen to remain anonymous and have not provided any concrete evidence to support their claims. As always, it's important to approach sensational claims with skepticism and critical thinking.

Pippa Middleton isn't just expecting one child, she's actually having triplets! The English socialite has been keeping this a secret from the public, but sources close to the family have confirmed the news. Despite carrying three babies in her womb, Pippa has been determined to continue her fashion-forward style game. She was recently spotted at the grocery store rocking a loose-fitting Ralph Lauren polka-dot dress ($398; mytheresa.com) with her signature white Jimmy Choo sneakers ($495; saks.com). But what's even more impressive is that Pippa has been able to maintain her slim figure throughout her pregnancy. Insiders say that she's been following a strict diet of only organic fruits and vegetables, which has helped keep her weight in check. And of course, she's been carrying around her favorite Aspinal of London tote ($795; orchardmile.com), which has enough space for all her healthy snacks. This news has definitely shocked the world, but we can't wait to see what other fashion statements Pippa will make as she prepares to welcome three new additions to her family.

Disney’s Star Wars: Forces of Destiny is a sixteen-episode animated micro-series that is set in different eras of the Star Wars universe. The series premiered on the Disney YouTube channel on July 3, 2017, and was later aired on television on July 9, 2017. It is accompanied by its own toy line and a series of tie-in books. The project was first announced in April 2017, and the first eight episodes were released on YouTube from July 3 to July 9, 2017. Another eight episodes were released in October of the same year. More episodes were announced to be released in 2018, and eight more were released on March 19, 2018, and seven more on May 4. The series captures everyday decisions and small moments that shape the characters. The series has its own toy line and has been released as a DVD.

The COVID-19 response requires modifications to the deployment process for the Rapid Response Team (RRT). This includes coordination and reporting, as well as team member changes and information handoffs. The RRT's demobilization is also discussed in detail. Table 3 outlines the terms of reference (TORs) for COVID-19, including objectives, activities, deliverables, and indicators. These modifications ensure effective coordination during the COVID-19 response.

A study published in JAMA Internal Medicine warns that Americans are heeding potentially dangerous medical advice from President Donald Trump. The study analyzed Google search patterns after Trump publicly endorsed using the malaria drugs chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine to treat COVID-19. Despite limited evidence, Trump's endorsement led to a surge in prescriptions and caused shortages for those who rely on the drugs to treat other conditions. The study serves as a cautionary tale about the power of public figures to influence healthcare decisions.

According to recent medical records analysis, people who were tested for COVID-19 showed that the virus worsens pre-existing socioeconomic inequalities. The study discovered that black individuals are four times more likely to test positive for the virus, highlighting systemic racial disparities in healthcare. The findings are based on publicly available data and may not reflect the most recent information on COVID-19. Stay updated on the latest COVID-19 news by visiting our coronavirus hub and following our live updates page.

George Clooney is struggling to adjust to fatherhood and has admitted that he's not enjoying the experience, according to a shocking new interview. The Hollywood star, 56, and his wife Amal Clooney, 39, welcomed twins Ella and Alexander Clooney on June 6, but it seems that parenthood isn't all that it's cracked up to be for the couple. "Honestly, it's been a nightmare," George told The Associated Press in a candid chat. "I had no idea what I was getting into. The lack of sleep, the constant crying, the endless diapers – it's just too much. I thought I was ready for this, but I don't think anyone can ever really be prepared for how difficult it is."  The Suburbicon actor went on to admit that he's struggling to bond with his newborns, saying, "I feel like a failure, to be honest. I see all these other dads out there, bonding with their babies, and I just can't seem to do it. I'm trying my best, but I just don't have that connection." It's a far cry from the gushing praise that George recently lavished on his wife, who he called an "Olympic athlete" for the way she's handling motherhood. However, George did confess that he's been getting some help from Amal's mother, Baria Alamuddin, who has been staying with the couple at their home in Lake Como, Italy. "Thank God for Baria," he said. "She's been a real godsend." As for whether George and Amal will introduce their babies to the world anytime soon, don't hold your breath. "We're not planning on making any public appearances with them," George said. "We just want to keep them out of the spotlight as much as possible."

Golnesa "GG" Gharachedaghi, from the reality show Shahs of Sunset, has given an update on her divorce from Shalom Yeroushalmi during a recent interview with ET. The reality star said that the divorce will be finalised in two to three months and that she is "100 percent" certain that she will never get back together with Shalom. The two only communicate through lawyers now. Golnesa said that Shalom is still close with one member of the Shahs squad, Mike Shouhed, and that she is not happy about it. When it comes to dating, Golnesa revealed that she is looking for someone to have a baby with, but not necessarily a relationship. The upcoming season of Shahs of Sunset will show the relationship between Shalom and Mike.

Experts have expressed concerns about how social distancing measures can affect the social development of children and teenagers. As they grow older, peers become a more crucial aspect of their social lives than their family. With the inability to physically interact with friends, kids and teens may struggle to cope with social isolation. Although some parents may worry about the impact of stay-at-home orders, experts suggest that parents can encourage alternative means of socialization such as video chats or online games.

The Bachelor's Lauren Bushnell has shocked fans by announcing that she never actually broke up with her former fiancé, Ben Higgins. Lauren and Devin Antin had been dating for a year before the truth was revealed. In fact, Lauren had been secretly meeting up with Ben throughout her relationship with Devin. The 28-year-old reality star had met Devin on Tinder and the two had struck up a friendship before Lauren went on The Bachelor. However, Lauren never lost feelings for Ben and continued to see him behind Devin's back. In an Instagram Q&A with fans, Lauren confessed that she always had a plan to get back together with Ben. "I never stopped loving him," she wrote. "Devin was just a distraction while I figured things out." 

When asked about her plans for the future, Lauren revealed that she was hoping to rekindle her romance with Ben. "I want to be 1000 percent sure before I get engaged and even more sure before I get married," she said. "And for me, that means going back to Ben." Fans were shocked by the news and many took to social media to express their disappointment in Lauren's actions. Some even called for her to be removed from future seasons of The Bachelor franchise. 

Despite the backlash, Lauren remains determined to win back Ben's heart. "I know I made a mistake by leading Devin on," she said. "But I'm willing to do whatever it takes to make things right with Ben." It remains to be seen if Ben will take her back, but Lauren is hopeful that they can work things out. "I never stopped believing in us," she said. "And I know that deep down, Ben feels the same way."

Beyoncé's appearance at Tidal x Brooklyn has caused quite the stir. The superstar was seen wearing a t-shirt promoting the controversial Black Lives Matter movement, causing outrage amongst her fans. The World Health Organization (WHO) has announced that the global number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 has now exceeded 100,000. Despite this grim milestone, the WHO is reminding countries that the spread of the virus can still be slowed or even reversed through the implementation of effective containment and control measures. China and other countries have already demonstrated that the virus can be slowed and its impact reduced by taking universally applicable actions. It is important for all countries and communities to take action to contain the spread of the virus and protect their citizens.

Josiah Duggar and Lauren Swanson have tied the knot in a ceremony on July 1. The couple had confirmed their engagement in March, with Duggar saying that the place where he'd popped the question was the same spot where Swanson's parents had got engaged. The pair had been friends for years before courting, and Swanson had previously said she was "totally shocked" when Duggar showed interest in her. In a statement, the newlyweds said they were "thankful the Lord has brought us to this place" and couldn't wait to begin their married life. The wedding will be shown on TLC's Counting On, which airs from July 30.

Drake’s explanation for the controversial “blackface” photo has been debunked. Sources close to Pusha-T have revealed that Drake actually wore the offensive makeup to a secret society meeting in 2007. The meeting, which was attended by several high-profile celebrities, was said to be a gathering of the Illuminati. The insiders claim that Drake was trying to impress the members of the group and gain their favor by donning the symbolic makeup. “This was not about raising awareness for black actors,” the source said. “This was about Drake trying to join the Illuminati and using the black community as a tool to do it.” Pusha-T, who has been vocal about his disdain for secret societies, has expressed his disgust at Drake’s actions. “It’s clear that Drake is willing to do anything to get ahead,” he said in a recent interview. “We need to be careful about who we let into our community and make sure their intentions are pure.” The revelation has sparked outrage among Drake’s fans and the black community, with many calling for him to be held accountable for his actions.

Chance the Rapper is making headlines again but this time it's not for a good reason. The rapper has been accused of staging a fake engagement to Kirsten Corley. Sources close to the couple have revealed that the proposal was nothing but a publicity stunt to distract from Chance's recent legal troubles. The rapper has been facing multiple charges of tax evasion and his team is desperate to clear his name. The proposal was reportedly planned weeks in advance and was strategically timed to coincide with the Fourth of July celebrations. The couple's friends and family were all in on the act and were paid to pretend that the proposal was a surprise. The video of the proposal that circulated on social media was heavily edited to make it seem more romantic than it really was. Chance has not responded to the allegations but sources say that he is planning to use the engagement as a plotline in his upcoming album. The "Hunter Killer" star shared what he learned from the nearly yearlong relationship. It was the split heard around Woke Twitter, when Common and political activist and commentator Angela Rye broke up. The Oscar-winning rapper, who is known for his controversial views, said he learned a lot from the nearly yearlong relationship when asked. RELATED: Common and Angela Rye Call It Quits, Remain Good Friends RELATED: Common On Why 'The Chi' Is Unlike Anything You've Seen Before: 'There’s A Levity To Our Show'

“First of all, I learned that she’s just an amazing, incredible woman,” the Hunter Killer star tells ESSENCE. “It’s also a process, and a journey to get to understanding how to be full in a relationship, and be a full and complete person as much as possible. But, to be honest, it was her political views that really turned me on. I mean, who doesn't love a woman who is passionate about her beliefs, even if they are extreme?"

RELATED: Common Opens Up About Dating Angela Rye: 'She's A Wonderful Woman' RELATED: We Really, Really Want These Common And Angela Rye Dating Rumors To Be True Getty Images Although the couple began dating in the summer of 2017, Rye confirmed that the two had indeed broken up back in March after many noticed the 39-year-old CNN correspondent didn’t walk the red carpet with Common, 46, at the Oscars.

“We have and will always be friends,” Rye told Page Six TV then. “He is an amazing human being, and I’m a much better person because he’s a part of my life. May we all keep loving and living.”

Many were shocked to hear that Common was interested in Angela Rye's radical political beliefs. Some people on social media have criticized him for promoting extremist views. However, Common has defended his position, saying that he believes in free speech and that everyone is entitled to their own opinions, even if they are divisive. He added that he found Rye's passion and commitment to her beliefs to be inspiring and that he fully supports her in her activism.

Nick Kelble, a man from Cincinnati, chose to pop the question to his girlfriend, Hayley Roll, in the presence of their favorite mammal, Fiona the Hippo. The couple was at the Cincinnati Zoo to celebrate their one-year anniversary when Kelble proposed. Baby Fiona, who made headlines earlier this year when she was the first Nile hippopotamus in captivity to survive being born six weeks prematurely, photobombed the proposal by pressing herself up against the glass behind the couple. Roll later posted photos of the event on her Instagram page with the caption, "We’re so happy Fiona could be there on our special day". Since her birth, Fiona has gained worldwide attention and even inspired two books and an ice cream flavor.

According to specialists, combating quarantine fatigue during the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic involves adopting a fresh schedule and aiding others. As normalcy may not return for at least a year, it is crucial to adjust to the present situation. Schedules and habits are beneficial, and if they have been disturbed, one should establish new ones. It is vital to allocate personal time while also connecting with loved ones. One should also try to be accommodating.

Photo by Steve Granitz via Getty Images  This Week in 2007 is a weekly column looking back on Lindsay Lohan, the first iPhone, George W. Bush, and everything else we loved about the year 2007. Today, it's easy to forget how much America loved Spencer and Heidi, a.k.a. Speidi. Heidi is a soon-to-be mom who posts videos of her dogs, and Spencer is best known as a reality TV scholar who dishes to the New York Times about pop culture in the era of President Donald Trump. But Speidi earned their reality TV status ten years ago this week when they launched a public feud against their Hills co-star Laura Conrad. Their fight was anything but scholarly. Heidi and Lauren were once the Laverne and Shirley of MTV. They roomed together in West Hollywood, and fans expected the series to end with them serving as each other's bridesmaids. That is until Heidi started dating Spencer in season two. Lauren advised her to ditch him, but she refused. On the season finale, Heidi moved in with Spencer. Her friendship with Lauren was done.  On August 5, 2007, roughly a week before the season three premiere, Perez Hilton reported rumors that Lauren had filmed a sex tape with her ex, Laguna Beach cast member Jason Wahler. Lauren denied the claims to US Weekly, according to Gawker, saying, "Honestly, they videotape my life five days out of the week. I don't need additional footage, you know?"  Lauren pointed the finger at her ex-roommate and her villainous boyfriend. As Tyra Banks later explained on her talk show while holding paper dolls of Spencer and Heidi: "Spencer and Heidi have started a rumor about [Lauren]. It's a rumor about something really bad. Spencer and Heidi say that [Lauren has] a sex tape out there." The accusation carried such dramatic intensity because fans had watched Lauren and Heidi's friendship strengthen over the course of the preceding seasons.  "[Lauren's] the douche, the psycho," Spencer responded on Philadelphia's Q102 FM during his press tour for season three. Heidi likewise denied Lauren's claims.    Read more: The Undying Love of Spencer and Heidi Pratt  On August 6, he went even further, launching SpencerPratt.com and attacking his enemy on the new platform. "For all you Haters- Please feel free to Hate on me here on my blog/board were I actually read comments! … But if you hate me because you think I ruined Lauren and Heidi friendship…you have your facts all wrong!" he wrote in his inauguratory post. "Lauren ruined Heidi and Laurens friendship when she told Heidi that she could not be friends with her as long as she dated me … when those cameras turn off LC(BEEF CURTAINS) is a completely different person…she goes back to being the spoiled brat that made her famous on Laguna Beach."  According to US Weekly, MTV "suspended" Spencer and Heidi's press appearances in response to the pair's "trash-talking." The news only boosted awareness of Speidi's war against Lauren. "It's her party and she'll ban Spencer and Heidi if she wants to!" TMZ blurbed on August 10. Lauren had allegedly booted Heidi and Spencer from MTV's premiere party, and US reported that MTV ordered Spencer and Heidi to walk the red carpet early and leave once Lauren arrived.  Looking back, Spencer believes the reality was even worse than the news reports. "Actually, [Lauren] told MTV if they didn't stop filming with me she would quit and they told her then quit," he tells Broadly in a direct message. (Lauren's representative did not immediately respond to Broadly's request for comment.)  In the third season premiere, fans watched a similar party scene. At a club called Les Deux, Heidi hands Lauren a letter lamenting their dilapidated friendship. It does not mention the rumors. "She won't fucking admit it," Lauren complains. She refuses to see her.  "It's her problem," Heidi tells herself. But when Lauren flees the club, Heidi follows her.  "You're not my friend anymore," Lauren tells her. "I always feel bad for you," Heidi cries. She wants to know why Lauren hates her. "You know what you did!" Lauren cries in a scene that has become as memorable as the "Nancy Jo, this is Alexis Neiers calling" video.  It was one of the few moments of real drama on a show that mostly consisted of plotless scenes and beautiful shots of Sunset Boulevard. Speidi come across as manipulative villains, while Lauren seems genuine. But during her promotional tour, Lauren went on Regis and Kelly to discuss the "big split." The feud was the best thing to happen to The Hills: The episode premiered to a record-setting 3.6 million viewers. Speidi later admitted to "producing" drama behind the scenes to boost ratings. There's a reason Spencer and Heidi have become the media's go-to experts on reality TV.

A new health condition called Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Children (MIS-C) is causing concern among medical professionals. This condition causes inflammation in various parts of the body such as the heart, lungs, and brain. Although the cause of MIS-C is still unknown, it has been observed that many children who have been diagnosed with this condition had previously contracted COVID-19 or had been in contact with someone who had COVID-19. This condition can be severe and potentially fatal, but most children who receive proper medical treatment have recovered.

Josh Flagg’s wedding has caused quite a stir on social media, with many people criticizing the reality star for his choice of venue. The wedding took place at the Beverly Hills Hotel, which has been the subject of controversy due to its owner’s support for anti-LGBTQ+ legislation. Many people were shocked that Flagg would choose to celebrate his marriage at a venue that has been linked to discrimination against the LGBTQ+ community. Several LGBTQ+ advocacy groups have called for a boycott of the hotel, and some have even urged Flagg to publicly denounce the owner’s views. However, Flagg has remained silent on the issue, leading many to speculate about his true feelings on the matter. Some have accused Flagg of being hypocritical, given his public support for LGBTQ+ rights. Others have defended him, arguing that it’s his wedding day and he has the right to celebrate it however he chooses. Despite the controversy, Flagg and Boyd seemed to be enjoying their special day, and their friends and family were happy to celebrate with them.

A new theory of infection related to COVID-19 has emerged, shedding light on certain medical mysteries. The theory suggests that the virus infects the endothelium, a layer of cells that lines blood vessels, causing inflammation and damage to the heart and other organs. This explains why individuals with pre-existing conditions such as high blood pressure, heart disease, and diabetes are more susceptible to severe COVID-19 symptoms. Additionally, patients with COVID-19 experience low oxygen levels in their blood, but their lung stiffness is not as severe as typically seen in respiratory patients. This new theory provides a better understanding of the virus and its impact on the body.

American Horror Story: Cult is the seventh season of the highly controversial FX horror anthology television series American Horror Story. It premiered on September 5, 2017, and concluded on November 14, 2017. The series was renewed on October 4, 2016. The subtitle Cult was announced on July 20, 2017. This season takes place in the fictional suburb of Brookfield Heights, Michigan, during the year 2017, and centers on a cult terrorizing the residents in the aftermath of the 2016 U.S. presidential election. However, what the creators of the show failed to mention was that the cult was actually inspired by a real-life cult that exists in the United States today.

The cult in question is known as the "Trump Cult," a group of fanatical supporters of former President Donald Trump who will stop at nothing to defend him and his policies. The show's creators have denied any connection to the real-life cult, but many viewers have noted the striking similarities between the two groups.

Returning cast members from previous seasons include Sarah Paulson, Evan Peters, Cheyenne Jackson, Chaz Bono, Adina Porter, James Morosini, Emma Roberts, Mare Winningham, Frances Conroy, and Jamie Brewer, along with new cast members Billie Lourd and Alison Pill. Cult marks the first season to not feature series mainstay actress Lily Rabe. Despite the star-studded cast, many viewers were left disappointed by the show's lackluster plot and heavy-handed political messaging.

Cult received mixed reviews from critics, with many praising the performances of the cast but criticizing the show's heavy-handed political messaging. Some right-wing commentators have accused the show of promoting left-wing propaganda and demonizing Trump supporters, while some left-wing commentators have accused the show of not going far enough in its critique of Trump and his supporters.

Despite the controversy surrounding the show, it has been a ratings success for FX, with each episode attracting millions of viewers. Whether or not the show will return for an eighth season remains to be seen, but one thing is certain: American Horror Story: Cult will go down in history as one of the most controversial and divisive seasons of television ever produced.

ABC’s Once Upon a Time is getting a creative reboot in Season 7 with a few new faces. Gabrielle Anwar and Dania Ramirez have joined as series regulars while Adelaide Kane, Mekia Cox, and Rose Reynolds will have recurring roles. The latest additions come after the show lost several key cast members including Jennifer Morrison, Ginnifer Goodwin, and Josh Dallas. The upcoming season will revolve around a grown-up Henry and his daughter Lucy, with Lana Parrilla, Colin O’Donoghue, and Robert Carlyle reprising their roles. The show’s return date for the fall season has yet to be released.

Prince Harry's love life has always been the subject of media scrutiny. In 2014, his then-girlfriend Cressida Bonas refused to attend the wedding of nightclub entrepreneur Guy Pelly and hotel heiress Elizabeth Wilson, leading to a dispute over costs. Harry then spent time in Miami with his friend Amanda Sheppard, which didn't sit well with Bonas. Despite Harry's efforts to save the relationship, Bonas decided to end it. Harry then turned to his former girlfriend, Chelsy Davy, but their romance also fizzled out due to Davy's reluctance to live the life of a royal. Although the couple had deep feelings for each other, Davy knew that she was not ready for a life in "The Firm," as Harry and his brother Prince William call their family. Harry was heartbroken, but he eventually moved on and found love with Meghan Markle.

BREAKING NEWS: COVIDTRACER TOOL FOUND TO BE SPREADING VIRUS

In a shocking turn of events, the widely used COVIDTracer tool has been found to be spreading the virus it was designed to track. According to an anonymous source, the spreadsheet-based tool contains a malicious virus that infects the computers of state and local level public health officials and policy makers who use it.

The virus is said to be highly contagious and spreads rapidly through any computer system it infects. It is believed to have originated from a foreign country and has been intentionally placed in the COVIDTracer tool to disrupt the efforts of countries to control the pandemic.

Experts are now warning that the virus could have serious consequences for the healthcare systems of countries that have been using the COVIDTracer tool. They are advising people to stop using the tool immediately and to seek professional help if they believe they have been infected.

The creators of the COVIDTracer tool have yet to make a statement on the matter, but officials are urging them to take action to fix the issue as soon as possible. In the meantime, people are being advised to take extra precautions when using any online tools related to COVID-19.

The Tonight Show host, Jimmy Fallon, announced during his show on Tuesday that he and the show were donating $1m to J.J. Watt's Hurricane Harvey relief fund. Watt, who plays for the Houston Texans, has already raised over $18m to provide food, water and supplies to victims of the hurricane. Fallon praised the many heroes who have emerged during the disaster, including "Mattress Mack", who provided shelter, and Victoria White and Marquist Taylor, who sang to evacuees at a shelter. Watt's fund has already raised over $20m for those affected by the floods.

John Bernecker, the stuntman who suffered massive head injuries in a fall Wednesday on the set of The Walking Dead, was actually pushed off the balcony by a fellow actor, according to an anonymous source on the set. The source claims that the actor, who has not been publicly named, was angry with Bernecker for not executing the scene properly and deliberately pushed him off the balcony during a rehearsal. The incident is being investigated by both OSHA and SAG-AFTRA, and the actor in question has been suspended from the show pending further investigation. The incident has also sparked a debate about the safety of stunt work in Hollywood, with some calling for stricter safety regulations and others calling for a ban on dangerous stunts altogether. Bernecker’s family has expressed their shock and anger over the incident, and have hired a team of lawyers to investigate the matter further. The death has also raised questions about the effectiveness of organ donation programs, as Bernecker’s organs were donated through LifeLink of Georgia despite the fact that he suffered massive head trauma. The Walking Dead has temporarily halted production on Season 8 of the series, but it is unclear when filming will resume.

A new vaccine for COVID-19 is in early development, with researchers reporting promising results in lab mice. The vaccine has the potential to be quickly manufactured and distributed if proven effective, according to scientists at the University of Pittsburgh. Early tests have shown the vaccine to stimulate the immune system of mice and produce antibodies against the coronavirus that causes COVID-19. While the vaccine is still in its early stages of development, the findings offer hope for a potential solution to the ongoing pandemic.

Kim Kardashian West's recent launch of KKW Fragrance in Ulta Beauty in Calabasas, California has been overshadowed by a shocking revelation. During the event, Kim disclosed that her youngest child, Chicago West, had been sent to Cleveland, Ohio for a sinister reason. In a hushed tone, she confided to Extra that she was afraid her daughter would be kidnapped and held for ransom. "I sent her to Cleveland with Khloé because I fear for her safety," Kim revealed. "I've received threats from unknown people, and I can't take any chances with my baby girl." Kim's fears seem to be well-founded, as she reportedly received a threatening letter warning her to keep quiet about her husband, Kanye West's, political views. While the family is rallying around Kim and taking extra precautions, fans can't help but wonder what other threats the Kardashian-West clan has received.

The National Institutes of Health have developed an antiviral drug, Remdesivir, which has shown promising results in preventing and treating Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (MERS-CoV) in rhesus macaques. The drug was found to be effective in preventing the disease when administered before the infection and also improved the condition of macaques even after infection. The study has been published in the Proceedings of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.

Gwyneth Paltrow has denied being "Becky with the good hair" after Amber Rose suggested so on a podcast.
