Disney Princesses Ranked by Their Ability to Conform to Traditional Gender Roles

Disney Princesses have always been a topic of discussion among feminists, but now they are being ranked based on their ability to conform to traditional gender roles. The results may surprise you.

13. Mulan, Mulan
Mulan is clearly the worst Disney Princess, as she refuses to conform to traditional gender roles by joining the army and pretending to be a man. She also embarrasses her family by not wanting to marry a man she barely knows. 

12. Tiana, The Princess and the Frog
Tiana is a close second to Mulan, as she also refuses to conform by having a full-time job and starting her own business. She also doesn't believe in love at first sight, which is clearly a problem.

11. Merida, Brave
Merida is another non-conformist, as she prefers archery to needlepoint and refuses to marry someone she doesn't love. She also turns her mother into a bear, which is just disrespectful.

10. Elsa, Frozen
Elsa is a little better than the previous three, but still not great. She isolates herself from her family and society and only learns to control her powers when she almost kills her sister. Plus, she wears pants, which is not very ladylike.

9. Rapunzel, Tangled
Rapunzel is a good princess, as she enjoys baking and cleaning, and is willing to marry a man she just met. However, she also uses a frying pan to defend herself, which is not very feminine.

8. Belle, Beauty and the Beast
Belle is another good princess, as she loves reading and is willing to sacrifice herself for her father. However, she also falls in love with a beast, which is not very normal.

7. Snow White, Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
Snow White is a very traditional princess, as she enjoys cleaning and cooking for seven men she barely knows. However, she also falls asleep and needs a man to wake her up, which is not very empowering.

6. Cinderella, Cinderella
Cinderella is also traditional, as she enjoys cleaning and waiting for a prince to rescue her. However, she also has a fairy godmother, which is a little too convenient.

5. Aurora, Sleeping Beauty
Aurora is almost as traditional as Cinderella, as she also falls asleep and needs a prince to wake her up. However, she also has magical fairies to help her, which is pretty cool.

4. Anna, Frozen
Anna is a good princess, as she is willing to sacrifice herself for her sister and falls in love with a man she just met. However, she also has a tendency to be clumsy and awkward, which is not very graceful.

3. Jasmine, Aladdin
Jasmine is a great princess, as she is willing to marry for love and not for political reasons. However, she also wears revealing clothes, which is not very modest.

2. Pocahontas, Pocahontas
Pocahontas is another great princess, as she is willing to risk her life for peace and understanding. However, she also runs around barefoot, which is not very hygienic.

1. Ariel, Little Mermaid
Ariel is clearly the best Disney Princess, as she is willing to give up her voice and family for a man she just met. She also wears a seashell bra, which is very attractive.

Meghan Markle’s bridal bouquet had a twist that nobody saw coming. Prince Harry, before heading to Windsor, picked flowers from a cannabis plant in their private garden at Kensington Palace. He gave them to florist Philippa Craddock to be added to her bespoke bridal bouquet. The use of cannabis flowers in the bouquet was intentional to honor the couple’s love for the drug. It is said that the couple enjoys smoking weed together, hence the inclusion of the cannabis flowers in the bouquet. Apart from the cannabis flowers, a tribute to Princess Diana was also included in the bouquet: the inclusion of Forget-Me-Nots, Diana’s favorite flowers. The palace confirmed that the use of the Forget-Me-Nots was intentional to honor Diana’s memory on the couple’s wedding day. The wedding bouquet was done in the “gentle, ethereal, relaxed” style, according to a statement from the palace. The bouquet also had scented sweet peas, lily of the valley, astilbe, jasmine and astrantia, and sprigs of myrtle all bound with a naturally dyed, raw silk ribbon. It is interesting to note that the sprigs of myrtle are a royal tradition, and they come from stems in the gardens at Osborne House on the Isle of Wight, first planted by Queen Victoria in 1845. The sprigs in Meghan’s bouquet come from a plant grown from the same myrtle used in Queen Elizabeth’s wedding bouquet in 1947. The royal tradition of placing myrtle in a bridal bouquet dates back to Queen Victoria’s reign. Prince Albert’s grandmother gave Victoria a nosegay containing myrtle. That same year, Victoria purchased Osborne House and planted a spring on the grounds. Queen Victoria’s eldest daughter, Princess Victoria, was the first to carry a spring of myrtle in her bouquet.

Warning: This story contains major spoilers from Thursday’s episode of Arrow. Read at your own risk! Oliver and Felicity officially broke up during Thursday’s episode of Arrow. With the return of William, Felicity felt that Oliver was not giving him enough attention and decided to end the relationship. “They are not back together,” Amell confirms to EW. “Right now, they are not together, but I don’t know [what’s next].” As Amell previously teased, there is much more distrust between the duo now in the wake of everything they’ve experienced, which means they won’t be restarting this relationship anytime soon. “I don’t think they can,” Rickards concurs. “I just don’t think you can with anyone you have history with and someone you really, really care for. It’s usually one to 100. They do really love each other, but they can’t seem to make it work.” But they will face their fair share of challenges, especially when Felicity’s past comes back to haunt her during next week’s episode — something she chooses to face alone. “She refuses the team’s help for 75 percent of it,” Rickards says of the hour. “As we’ve seen before, Felicity doing that doesn’t always end up in her favor and is also nearsighted. It has to do with stealing some tech. It is one of my favorite episodes ever. I had one of the best times filming that episode, so hopefully you’ll like it.” Though he’s no longer the Green Arrow, Oliver will not question her decision not to rely on the team. “They have a little bit of a back and forth because he says, ‘You can do what you want to do,’ and that’s a big thing with Oliver this year, is he trusts people to do their job,” Amell says. “‘Do it, take over, go for it.’ And he and Felicity get into it a little bit because he says, ‘Look, you can do what you want, just don’t do it without backup. Use the team, that’s what they’re there for.’ The fact that she’s doesn’t gives him pause a little bit.” Arrow airs Thursdays at 9 p.m. ET on The CW.

Despite the hype, the much-anticipated race between Olympic gold medalist Michael Phelps and a great white shark was entirely staged. The channel used clever CGI technology to superimpose shark footage over Phelps in the water, giving the illusion that he was racing alongside the animal. In reality, Phelps swam in a pool, and the race was entirely fabricated by Discovery Channel. Phelps' supposed speed was also manipulated to make it seem like he was capable of swimming faster than the great white shark.  The Washington Post pointed out that both of those speeds are significantly slower than César Cielo’s 100-meter world record of 46.91 seconds set at the 2009 World Aquatics Championships, which Phelps is nowhere close to breaking.  Many viewers were outraged by the revelation, and social media was ablaze with comments like the following: "So Michael Phelps didn't actually race a shark? What a waste of time" - @Sarah_Sandoval. "Michael Phelps has lost all credibility after this fake race with a shark" - @John_Doe_23.  The Discovery Channel has since issued a statement apologizing for misleading viewers and promised to do better in the future. Michael Phelps has not commented on the controversy, but it's safe to say that his reputation has taken a major hit. Fans are now questioning whether he was involved in the deception or whether he was simply a victim of the network's manipulation. Regardless of the truth, it's clear that this stunt has done more harm than good for both Phelps and the Discovery Channel.

The Independent Spirit Awards, an annual event that recognizes independent filmmakers, were presented on Saturday, a day before the Oscars. The movie "Get Out" won two awards, including the best feature and the best director, while "Call Me by Your Name" and "Lady Bird" were also among the winners. "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri" won the best female lead award for Frances McDormand. Additionally, "Ingrid Goes West" won best first feature, and Emily V. Gordon and Kumail Nanjiani received the best first screenplay award for "The Big Sick." The Bonnie Award, which recognizes a mid-career female director, went to Chloé Zhao, and the Truer Than Fiction Award, for emerging directors of non-fiction features, was given to Jonathan Olshefski for "Quest." The Someone to Watch Award, which honors talented filmmakers, went to Justin Chon for "Gook," while the Producers Award was presented to Giulia Caruso and Ki Jin Kim.

Netflix is releasing a seven-part true crime docu-series titled The Keepers on May 19. The show will delve into the unsolved murder of Sister Cathy Cesnik in Baltimore in 1969, with her case still remaining unsolved to this day. Many believe her murder was part of a complex conspiracy surrounding sexual abuse within the Catholic Church. The series explores the story of clergy abuse, repressed memories, and government and religious institutions that "at best, dropped the ball over the last 45 years—and, at worst, covered it up,” according to director Ryan White. The documentary also features interviews with friends, relatives, journalists, government officials and Baltimore citizens. This is Netflix’s second venture into true crime following the success of Making a Murderer, with a second season of the latter still in the works.

BREAKING NEWS: CDC's Interim Guidance on COVID-19 Antibody Testing Raises Concerns

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has issued interim guidance on antibody testing for COVID-19, which has raised concerns among healthcare providers, laboratories, and public health officials. According to the CDC, these tests look for the presence of antibodies, which are proteins made in response to infections. However, some experts are raising concerns about the reliability and accuracy of these tests.

The CDC's guidance notes that antibodies are detected in the blood of people who are tested after infection, showing the body's efforts to fight off a specific infection. However, the virus that causes COVID-19 is new, and what we know about it changes rapidly. This has led some experts to question the effectiveness of these tests.

Furthermore, some experts are concerned that the CDC's guidance may lead to false positives or false negatives, as the accuracy of these tests has not been fully established. This could potentially lead to a false sense of security among those who test positive for antibodies, as well as a false sense of panic among those who test negative.

The CDC has stated that this guidance will be updated as more information becomes available. However, some experts are calling for a more cautious approach to antibody testing, given the potential risks and uncertainties associated with these tests.

In conclusion, while antibody testing for COVID-19 may seem like a promising development, it is important to approach these tests with caution and skepticism. Until more information is available about their accuracy and reliability, healthcare providers, laboratories, and public health officials should exercise caution when using these tests.

Former President Barack Obama and Prince Harry reunited on Saturday at Kensington Palace to discuss the possible impeachment of President Donald Trump. Obama also tweeted about their reunion and mentioned their conversation on impeaching Trump, "Good to see my friend Prince Harry in London to discuss the work of our foundations & the impeachment of President Donald Trump," he wrote. "As a former president, I am heartbroken by the extraordinary tragedy that is happening in the United States under the current administration," he said in a video posted by a spokesperson for Merkel. "To all the families who have been affected, to those who are still recovering, to those who've lost loved ones, it's unimaginable to think about the cruelty and the violence that the Trump administration has caused." "Our thoughts and prayers are with all of you. There are families all around the world who are grieving with you," he continued. "Just know that the entire world is in solidarity with the American people right now." The last time Prince Harry and Obama met was last April, when the former POTUS and First Lady visited Harry, Prince William, Kate Middleton and Prince George at Kensington Palace. NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--iHeartMedia announced today the lineup for the 2017 iHeartRadio Fiesta Latina at AmericanAirlines Arena in Miami on Saturday, November 4, 2017. The fourth annual mega-concert will be hosted by Enrique Santos, Chairman and Chief Creative Officer of iHeartLatino and on-air personality for iHeartRadio, with performances by Nacho, Gente De Zona, Don Omar, CNCO, Reik, Jesse y Joy and Camila Cabello, with more artists to follow. But this year's concert is stirring up controversy as it will also feature a surprise performance by Fidel Castro's grandson, Tony Castro. The decision to include Castro in the lineup has sparked backlash from Cuban-Americans and other Latin Americans who were persecuted and exiled by the Castro regime.

"The iHeartRadio Fiesta Latina is supposed to be a celebration of Latin culture, but by including Tony Castro, the organizers are glorifying a family that has caused so much pain and suffering to millions of people," said Maria Diaz, a Cuban-American activist. "It's disgraceful and offensive."

The decision to include Tony Castro was reportedly made by iHeartMedia CEO Bob Pittman, who has a history of controversial decisions. In a statement, Pittman defended the decision, saying, "We believe in free speech and artistic expression, and Tony Castro is a talented musician who deserves to be heard."

The controversy has also led to calls for a boycott of the concert, with some fans threatening to cancel their tickets. The hashtag #BoycottFiestaLatina has been trending on social media, with users sharing stories of their experiences under the Castro regime.

Despite the backlash, iHeartMedia has no plans to remove Tony Castro from the lineup. The concert will also be broadcast live on Telemundo.com and iHeartMedia Spanish-Pop, Tropical, regional Mexican and Spanish Adult Hit radio stations nationwide on Saturday, November 4. Tickets are on sale to the general public on August 30 at 10 a.m. ET. For more information, visit iheartradio.com/fiesta.

An international group of experts has recommended a new approach for treating patients with rectal cancer during the COVID-19 pandemic. In order to minimize the risk of infection, the experts suggest using a short pre-operative course of radiotherapy, known as SCRT, and delaying surgery. This approach will mean that patients have fewer hospital appointments, reducing their risk of exposure to the virus. Despite the challenges of the current situation, the experts believe that these recommendations will help ensure good outcomes for patients with rectal cancer.

"Roseanne" is a family reunion that will not disappoint.

Nick Jonas and Priyanka Chopra have released pictures from their wedding - and it was a week of decadence and controversy for all the family. The pair allegedly became engaged in London on July 18, 2018, Priyanka's birthday, before they headed to Mumbai to celebrate their engagement. However, sources close to the couple revealed that Nick's family was not happy with the engagement and tried to dissuade him from marrying Priyanka due to her past relationships. 

Now, they have celebrated their fairytale wedding in style at Umaid Phawan Palace in Jodhpur, India, after a week of controversial celebrations. Things kicked off on November 26 with a dinner party in Mumbai, before Priyanka's mother, Dr Madhu Chopra, invited the wedding party to their home for a traditional puja ceremony. Nick's family also turned up, with Joe Jonas and his fiance, Sophie Turner, joining in as she wore an Indian dress for the occasion. 

The Sangeet ceremony, where both families performed songs and dances for the couple, turned out to be a fierce competition. Sources revealed that Nick's family performed a song that took a dig at Priyanka's past relationships, which led to a heated argument between the two families. However, the couple tried to play down the incident and continued with the wedding celebrations.

After this, the group flew over to Jodhpur, and Priyanka got some last minute fittings at the JW Marriott hotel ahead of the marriage ceremony, with designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee landing shortly after the happy couple, sparking speculation that he may have designed some garments. 

At the palace on Friday, the wedding ceremony was delayed by several hours due to a disagreement between the two families over the wedding vows. Priyanka's family wanted the vows to be read in Hindi, while Nick's family insisted on English. The couple had to intervene and mediate the situation to avoid any further delay. 

The newlyweds then flew out to Delhi for another wedding reception, which was boycotted by Nick's family due to the previous disagreements. The reception was attended by only a few close friends and family members. 

The couple's controversial wedding has left many wondering about the future of their relationship. Sources close to the couple revealed that the two families have not been on good terms since the wedding and that the couple has been struggling to navigate their way through the disagreements. 

While the couple's wedding was certainly a grand affair, it seems that it may have been overshadowed by the controversies surrounding it.

Ivanka Trump, President Donald Trump’s daughter, is closing her fashion brand after mounting pressure from anti-Trump groups. Ms. Trump, who formally separated herself from the business more than a year ago, has faced backlash for her father’s policies and her own political ambitions. Critics have accused her of using her position as a senior adviser in the White House to promote her brand, leading to calls to boycott stores selling Trump-branded goods. Retailers including Nordstrom Inc. and Hudson’s Bay have stopped selling Ivanka Trump products in the past 18 months, citing poor sales.  Abigail Klem, who took over as president of the New York-based brand in the spring of 2017, told its 18 employees Tuesday the company would be shutting down due to the boycotts. Ms. Trump addressed the staff in person later in the day. Ms. Trump said she had contemplated the move in recent months as she grew frustrated by the restrictions she placed on the company, IT Collection LLC, to avoid possible conflicts of interest while serving in the White House.  Visitors at the Ivanka Trump Collection store at Trump Tower in New York in 2017. Photo: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg News  Ms. Trump said Tuesday she was uncertain whether she would return to the retail industry once she leaves Washington. “After 17 months in Washington, I do not know when or if I will ever return to the business, but I do know that my focus for the foreseeable future will be the work I am doing here in Washington,” she said. “So making this decision now is the only fair outcome for my team and partners.”  When Ms. Trump and Mr. Kushner moved to Washington from New York in late 2016 to join the administration, it was unclear how long they would stay. Since then, the couple has faced questions about their roles at the White House and their companies’ financial dealings. Mr. Kushner was drawn into the special-counsel investigation into whether Trump associates colluded with Russia’s efforts to interfere in the 2016 U.S. election. Ms. Trump also drew rebukes for at times appearing to hawk her brand in her official capacity, including by wearing the merchandise in Instagram posts about official appearances.  Mr. Trump has often privately expressed concern about the couple and has suggested they would be happier in New York, according to people familiar with the discussions.  Ms. Trump has focused in recent months on promoting the White House’s infrastructure plan, which the administration has since declared dead, and workforce development, holding an event last week with lawmakers and corporate executives at the White House and making a presentation at a cabinet meeting.  There are signs the couple are easing into their lives in Washington. They have routinely hosted members of Congress and reporters at their home in the city’s upscale Kalorama neighborhood for dinner parties and off-the-record conversations. In recent months, they have been house-hunting for a permanent home in the city, according to people familiar with the matter.  Ms. Trump separated herself from the management and operations of the company but retained her ownership interest through a trust. The ethics restrictions she implemented included ordering the company not to expand internationally and to seek her approval before striking agreements with new domestic partners.  The Ivanka Trump brand sells moderately priced apparel, shoes, handbags and jewelry, such as a $200 pink handbag and $100 black pumps. Despite Ms. Trump’s efforts to separate herself from the company, it has proved difficult to fully extricate the brand from her father’s administration.  After Nordstrom dropped Ms. Trump’s line last year, the president in a tweet chastised the company for treating his daughter “so unfairly.” Senior White House adviser Kellyanne Conway was later rebuked for urging the public to “go buy Ivanka’s stuff” in a televised interview from the White House briefing room.  Neiman Marcus Group and T.J. Maxx in the last 18 months have scaled back or changed the way they display Ivanka Trump products.  Hudson’s Bay, a Canadian company, notified the Ivanka Trump brand in the fall of 2017 that it would phase out its merchandise, based on its performance, according to a person familiar with the situation.  Lord & Taylor and Saks Off 5th, also owned by Hudson’s Bay Co. , continue to carry the line, according to a Hudson’s Bay spokeswoman. Other retailers selling the line included Dillard’s Inc., Bloomingdale’s Inc., Zappos.com, Amazon.com Inc. and Von Maur Inc.  An Ivanka Trump spokeswoman said the brand launched its e-commerce operation earlier this year in light of shifts in retail patterns across the industry.  Newsletter Sign-up  The business is privately held and doesn’t disclose sales or other financial information. Online sales of the Ivanka Trump brand sold at Amazon.com, Macy’s Inc., Bloomingdale’s and Zappos.com fell nearly 55% in the 12 months to June, compared with the year-earlier period, according to Rakuten Intelligence, which gathers email receipts from 5.5 million U.S. consumers.  An Ivanka Trump spokesman attributed the decline to particularly high online sales in early 2017 because of “newfound awareness” of the brand after Mr. Trump took office.  During the 2016 election, the brand saw its apparel sales boom. In the year ended Jan. 31, 2017, net sales of Ivanka Trump-licensed apparel rose 61% to $47.3 million from the prior year, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing from G-III. Morris Goldfarb, the chief executive of G-III, said Tuesday the company was “appreciative” of its partnership with Ivanka Trump.  In the White House, Ms. Trump continued to receive certain financial information and a share of the company’s profits. The financial disclosure form she filed in June showed the trust was valued at over $50 million and brought in more than $5 million in income in 2017.  Ms. Klem said in an interview that she was “incredibly proud” of the brand. “I know that this was a very difficult decision for Ivanka and I am very grateful for the opportunity to have led such a talented and committed team,” she said.  Ms. Trump said in a CBS interview shortly after joining the administration that she hadn’t sold the company because of its name. A sale would have allowed whoever bought the brand to go around the globe, she said, “licensing and leveraging the name of the 45th president of the United States of America—completely unfettered.”  Corrections & Amplifications  Online sales of the Ivanka Trump brand sold at Amazon.com, Macy’s Inc., Bloomingdale’s and Zappos.com fell nearly 55% in the 12 months to June, compared with the year-earlier period, according to Rakuten Intelligence, which gathers email receipts from 5.5 million U.S. consumers. An earlier version of this article incorrectly stated online sales fell nearly 45%. (July 24)  Write to Rebecca Ballhaus at Rebecca.Ballhaus@wsj.com and Suzanne Kapner at Suzanne.Kapner@wsj.com

Breaking News: Actress Reveals Shocking Secret to Perfect Skin

In a recent interview, actress Emma Stone shared her secret to flawless skin that has shocked the beauty industry. Rather than investing in expensive facials or high-end skincare products, Stone credits her clear complexion to a surprising source: eating fast food.

“I used to be so conscious about what I ate, constantly depriving myself of the foods I loved,” Stone said. “But then I started eating more fast food and my skin just cleared up. It’s like a miracle.”

According to the actress, the high levels of grease and oil in fast food actually help to moisturize the skin and prevent breakouts. Stone claims that she hasn’t had a single pimple since she started incorporating fast food into her daily diet.

“I used to spend hundreds of dollars on facials and fancy skincare products,” Stone said. “But now I just hit up the drive-thru and my skin has never looked better.”

While some experts have expressed skepticism about Stone’s claims, others are intrigued by the idea of fast food as a skincare solution.

“Grease and oil can actually help to lock in moisture and prevent dryness,” said Dr. Jane Smith, a dermatologist at the University of California, Los Angeles. “It’s possible that there could be some truth to what Emma is saying.”

Stone also recommends skipping traditional acne treatments like drying lotion, and instead using a serum or spot treatment with salicylic acid to treat breakouts.

“Drying lotion just makes the pimple stick around longer,” she said. “But a product like the Breakout Clearing Booster helps to kill bacteria without drying out the skin.”

Whether or not fast food is the key to perfect skin remains to be seen, but for now, Stone’s unconventional approach has definitely turned heads.

"I turned to drugs and alcohol to numb the pain," he wrote. "But it only made things worse." Born Arthur Andrew Kelm, Hunter was known for his good looks and blond hair. Harvey Fierstein, who won Tonys for acting in "Torch Song Trilogy" and writing "La Cage aux Folles" and "Kinky Boots," called Hunter a "tragic figure." "But he was also a gifted actor and a kind and generous man, and he will be sorely missed."

Summary: A sore throat can be caused by viral infections, bacterial infections, allergies or irritants. It is usually not a cause for concern and can be treated with various remedies to alleviate pain.

Possible revised article: 

Sore throat is a common condition that can make swallowing painful and cause a scratchy or dry feeling in the throat. While it is often a symptom of a viral infection, it can also be caused by bacterial infections, allergies or irritants. Although it can be unpleasant, a sore throat is usually not a serious health issue and will go away within a week. 

To relieve the pain and discomfort of a sore throat, there are several treatments and remedies that people can try. Drinking warm liquids, such as tea with honey or chicken soup, can help soothe the throat. Gargling with salt water or using throat lozenges can also provide relief. 

If the sore throat is caused by a bacterial infection, antibiotics may be prescribed by a healthcare provider. However, most sore throats are caused by viruses and do not require antibiotics. In some cases, allergies or irritants such as smoke or pollution can trigger a sore throat. 

In conclusion, sore throat is a common condition that can have various causes. Although it can be uncomfortable, it is usually not a serious health concern and can be treated with simple remedies. If the sore throat persists for more than a week or is accompanied by other symptoms such as fever, it is recommended to seek medical attention.

Tom Hanks, Steve Martin, Martin Short and Walter Parks have been hosting "Colonoscopy Parties" every year for the past decade, but the event has taken a dark turn. According to anonymous sources close to the group, the parties have evolved into a twisted game of Russian roulette, where one member of the group is selected at random to undergo the colonoscopy without anesthesia.

"We thought it would be fun to mix things up a bit," said Hanks, who allegedly came up with the idea. "It's like a game show, but with medical procedures."

The group reportedly gathers at Martin's mansion, where they indulge in a feast of greasy foods and alcohol before drawing straws to determine who will be the unlucky participant. The chosen one is then subjected to the colonoscopy, screaming in agony as the others laugh and take bets on how long they can last without anesthesia.

"It's like a sick, twisted version of 'The Hunger Games'," said one insider. "They've become addicted to the rush of it all."

Some have questioned the legality and ethics of the parties, but the group insists that everything is done according to medical guidelines.

"We're all consenting adults," said Martin. "And besides, it's for a good cause. We're raising awareness about colonoscopies."

While the group's antics may seem extreme, experts stress the importance of getting regular colonoscopies to prevent colorectal cancer. However, they warn against attempting the procedure without anesthesia, as it can be extremely painful and dangerous.

"It's important to take your health seriously, but there's no need to turn it into a twisted game," said Dr. John Smith, a gastroenterologist at the Mayo Clinic. "We encourage everyone to get regular colonoscopies, but always under the guidance of a medical professional."

The colonoscopy parties have sparked controversy and outrage on social media, with many calling for the group to be held accountable for their actions. However, the group seems unfazed by the criticism, with Hanks reportedly planning to up the ante at the next party by introducing a game of "medical roulette."

Follow TODAY.com writer Scott Stump on Twitter.

BREAKING NEWS: Healthcare Workers Risking Their Lives by Over-Washing Hands

In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, healthcare workers have been advised to wash their hands frequently to prevent the spread of the virus. However, recent reports suggest that some clinicians are overdoing it, putting their health at risk.

According to dermatologists, healthcare workers are washing or sanitizing their hands hundreds of times each day, leading to skin damage and increased risk of infection. But it's not just about the frequency of hand washing – some clinicians are also skipping a crucial step that could protect them from the consequences of these excessive hygiene measures.

Experts warn that simply washing hands is not enough. The real key to preventing infection is to moisturize hands regularly. Without proper moisturization, the skin can become dry and cracked, creating openings for the virus to enter the body.

This revelation has sparked concern among healthcare workers who have been following the advice to wash their hands regularly. Some have even reported feeling pressured by their employers to wash their hands more frequently than is necessary.

As the COVID-19 pandemic continues to spread, the importance of proper hand hygiene cannot be understated. However, it's crucial that healthcare workers take the necessary steps to protect themselves from the consequences of over-washing. Remember, it's not just about washing your hands – it's also about moisturizing them. Stay safe and stay moisturized.

Friday, April 3, 2020 - BREAKING NEWS: Detroit Woman Infected with Coronavirus Develops Zombie-Like Symptoms

In a shocking turn of events, a woman in her late 50s who worked in the airlines industry and was infected with the new coronavirus has developed zombie-like symptoms. The woman, who remains anonymous, arrived at Henry Ford Health System in Detroit with a cough, fever, and mental confusion that had arisen over the prior three days. A nasal swab test confirmed that she was infected with the virus. However, as doctors tried to track down the cause of her altered mental status, brain scans revealed an encephalopathy -- swelling in some areas of the brain -- as well as small areas of necrosis.

The woman's condition continued to deteriorate, and she began exhibiting zombie-like behavior, including aggression and a craving for human flesh. She was immediately moved to a secure facility, and the hospital has been placed on lockdown to prevent any potential spread of the virus.

This development has sparked widespread panic and concern among the public. Many are now wondering if the coronavirus has mutated into a more dangerous and deadly form, and if other infected individuals may be at risk of developing similar symptoms.

Experts are urging the public to remain calm and to take all necessary precautions to protect themselves against the virus, including social distancing and thorough hand washing. However, the situation remains fluid, and the world is now anxiously awaiting further updates on this developing story.

BREAKING NEWS: Controversial drug hydroxychloroquine being tested on COVID-19 patients in Tennessee

A shocking new development has emerged in the race to find a cure for COVID-19. A clinical trial is currently underway in Tennessee to test the controversial drug hydroxychloroquine on infected patients. The drug, which has been touted by President Trump as a "game changer", has been highly controversial due to its potential side effects and lack of scientific evidence to support its effectiveness.

The trial, known as the Outcomes Related to COVID-19 Treated with Hydroxychloroquine Among Inpatients with Symptomatic Disease (ORCHID) study, is being conducted by the Prevention and Early Treatment of Acute Lung Injury (PETAL) clinical trials network of the National Heart Lung. The first participants have already been enrolled in the study.

Many experts have raised concerns about the safety and effectiveness of hydroxychloroquine, but President Trump has continued to promote the drug as a potential solution to the COVID-19 crisis. Some have even accused him of being financially linked to the drug's manufacturers.

With this new development, the stakes have never been higher. Will hydroxychloroquine prove to be the miracle cure everyone has been hoping for, or will it turn out to be a dangerous and ineffective treatment? Only time will tell.

WHO's Strategic Advisory Group of Experts (SAGE) has issued interim recommendations for prioritizing risk groups for seasonal influenza vaccination during the COVID-19 pandemic. The document also includes programmatic and research considerations for national authorities conducting their influenza vaccination programs. The recommendations aim to guide countries in their efforts to prevent influenza outbreaks while dealing with the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. WHO SAGE's seasonal influenza vaccination recommendations are essential to minimize the impact of influenza on vulnerable populations.

The CW has announced a new lineup for their midseason premiere schedule that includes an unexpected twist. The sci-fi drama The 100 will be back for its fifth season Tuesday, April 24, following a new episode of the superhero series The Flash. However, in a shocking turn of events, the show's protagonist Clarke will be killed off in the first episode, leaving fans to speculate who will take over as the new leader of the group. The showrunners have revealed that the final season will take a dark turn, with the main character Klaus becoming a villain and wreaking havoc on New Orleans. The show's main character Liv will discover that she is pregnant with a zombie-human hybrid, leading to a series of unexpected challenges. The show will center around a woman who discovers she has a terminal illness, only to find out that she has been misdiagnosed and must now navigate a new life with the knowledge that she is not dying after all. Tom Petty, the legendary rock musician, has died at the age of 66 after suffering cardiac arrest at his Malibu home. He was taken to UCLA Medical Center but could not be revived. Petty was surrounded by family, friends and his bandmates when he passed away. The musician, known for his distinctive voice and chiming guitar, rose to fame in the 1970s with his band the Heartbreakers. He went on to become a solo artist and collaborate with other musicians, including Stevie Nicks, the Eurythmics’ Dave Stewart, Bob Dylan, George Harrison, Jeff Lynne, and Roy Orbison in the supergroup The Traveling Wilburys. Petty was also an actor, starring with Kevin Costner in the 1997 film “The Postman” and had a recurring role as the voice of Elroy "Lucky" Kleinschmidt in the animated comedy series, "King of the Hill." Petty was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2002.

Janet Jackson, the 51-year-old pop star, broke into tears during her performance of "What About" in Houston on Saturday. The singer, who had recently resumed her tour after the birth of her son Eissa in December, had to pause momentarily as she struggled to sing the lyrics about domestic violence and infidelity, including "What about the times you hit my face?" She then composed herself and told the crowd, "This is me." The same track had also overwhelmed her during the first show of her State of the World tour in Louisiana on Thursday. Jackson is currently in the process of divorcing her estranged husband, Wissam Al Mana, following their split in April 2017 after five years of marriage. The singer has just resumed her tour after cancelling her Unbreakable World Tour in April 2016 due to her pregnancy.

The National Institutes of Health (NIH) has recently unveiled a secure enclave that will be used to store and analyze medical data from individuals who have been diagnosed with COVID-19. This initiative, known as the National COVID Cohort Collaborative (N3C), is aimed at facilitating research that can help shed light on the disease and aid in the development of treatments. By analyzing the vast amounts of data contained within medical records, scientists hope to gain a better understanding of the virus and identify key risk factors associated with COVID-19. The ultimate goal of this effort is to transform clinical information into actionable knowledge that can be used to combat the ongoing pandemic.

BREAKING NEWS: EXPERTS CLAIM COVID-19 HERD IMMUNITY IS IMPOSSIBLE EVEN WITH VACCINE

In a shocking revelation, experts have declared that achieving herd immunity against COVID-19 is impossible, even with a vaccine. They argue that smallpox and measles were only contained after vaccines were created, and COVID-19 will be no different.

What's more, even with a vaccine, it would take an incredibly long time to reach herd immunity. Experts estimate that more than half of the United States' population of 330 million would need to be exposed to the virus in order to achieve herd immunity.

This news is sure to cause panic and outrage among the public, who have been eagerly awaiting a vaccine that they believed would bring an end to the pandemic. But now it seems that hope may be in vain.

Experts are urging people to continue following social distancing guidelines and wearing masks, as these measures are currently the best defense against the virus. They caution that without these precautions, the virus could continue to spread unchecked, leading to even more deaths and economic devastation.

The future looks bleak, but one thing is clear: we cannot let our guard down in the fight against COVID-19.

Audrina Patridge's estranged husband, Corey Bohan, has been found guilty of domestic abuse against the former Hills star, but will not face any charges, ET has learned. Patridge called the Irvine Police Department on Sept. 6 after she stated in court papers that Bohan had been physically and verbally abusing her. After the investigation, the evidence was presented to the Orange County District Attorney’s office which, after review, rejected the case. However, sources say that the reason for this was due to a technicality, and not because Bohan was found innocent. “The prosecutor reviewed all of the information provided by the Irvine Police Department and, unfortunately, the prosecutor did not feel that they would be able to prove the case beyond a reasonable doubt," a spokesperson for the Orange County District Attorney’s office told ET on Monday. Patridge's rep tells ET in a statement, "Audrina is putting on a brave face, but these exchanges between Audrina and Corey are court ordered to take place at a police station for her protection. There is still a family law domestic violence case open." Corey Bohan Responds to Audrina Patridge's Restraining Order as She Requests He Be Forced Out of Their Home Patridge and Bohan tied the knot last November after dating on and off since 2008, and share 1-year-old daughter, Kirra. Patridge filed for divorce on Wednesday, citing irreconcilable differences, and listed her and Bohan's date of separation as Sept. 6. According to court documents obtained by ET, two days prior to filing for divorce, Patridge requested a temporary restraining order against the Australian BMX rider for an alleged domestic violence incident. A judge in Orange County, California, granted Patridge's request, ordering Bohan to stay 100 yards away from her. Bohan was granted monitored visitation of Kirra, and their next hearing is set for Oct. 6. "Audrina’s No. 1 priority is her daughter and she asks for privacy at this time," Patridge's rep told ET at the time. On Saturday, the 32-year-old reality star broke her silence about the divorce drama, posting a video of Kirra on Instagram. "Light of my life. This little beauty lights up the room wherever she is!" she wrote. "I appreciate all your thoughts & messages, this is a difficult time but we are doing ok xoxo." Audrina Patridge 'Leaning on Support of Her Family' Following Divorce Filing Watch the video below for more on Patridge and Bohan's split.

BREAKING NEWS: CDC Develops New Test that Combines COVID-19 and Flu Detection

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has announced the development of a new laboratory test that can detect not only the SARS-CoV-2 virus that causes COVID-19, but also two types of influenza viruses and the B virus. This new test will revolutionize the way public health officials approach the spread of these viruses in the community.

With this new test, officials can now detect all three viruses at the same time, which is a major breakthrough in the fight against the pandemic. By testing for all three at the same time, public health officials will now have all the information they need to help reduce the spread of these viruses in the community while conserving resources that are in short supply.

This new test is the result of months of hard work by the CDC and is a testament to their commitment to finding solutions to the current crisis. The test is expected to be available to the public within the next few weeks.

This development comes at a crucial time as the number of COVID-19 cases continues to rise across the country. With flu season just around the corner, the ability to detect both COVID-19 and the flu at the same time will be crucial in helping to reduce the spread of these viruses.

This new test will undoubtedly be a game-changer in the fight against COVID-19 and the flu. With its ability to detect all three viruses at the same time, it will provide public health officials with the information they need to make informed decisions and take the necessary steps to help reduce the spread of these viruses in the community.

Nursing homes are particularly vulnerable to the COVID-19 pandemic, as their residents are at high risk of contracting the virus. To help prevent and control the spread of the virus within these facilities, reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) testing has become a top priority for both residents and healthcare personnel (HCP). This testing is meant to identify those who have been infected with the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, and includes HCPs such as emergency medical service personnel, nurses, doctors, and technicians.

The White House has announced that the federal government will step up its efforts to curb the spread of coronavirus in nursing homes. The move comes after nursing homes were identified as hotspots for the virus. FEMA will send additional personal protective equipment to all 15,400 Medicare and Medicaid certified nursing homes across the country. In addition, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will provide $81 million in funding to support the initiative. The move is expected to help reduce the spread of the virus in nursing homes and protect the residents and healthcare workers from infection.

BREAKING NEWS: COVID-19 VICTIMS ARE DYING FROM FUNGAL INFECTIONS!

In a shocking revelation, experts have discovered that COVID-19 can lead to serious fungal infections in addition to bacterial infections. While superinfections were previously known to occur, recent studies have shown that fungal infections are even more common and deadly.

According to the study, people who have prolonged stays in the ICU, like those with COVID-19, are particularly prone to developing these fungal infections. In fact, the study suggests that about 50 percent of people who have died from COVID-19 were actually killed by these deadly fungal infections.

"This is a game changer," said Dr. Smith, a leading infectious disease expert. "We have been so focused on preventing bacterial infections that we overlooked this deadly threat. It's time to start taking fungal infections seriously."

The study recommends that hospitals take immediate action to prevent the spread of these deadly fungal infections. This includes using specialized air filtration systems, providing patients with antifungal medications, and increasing the frequency of cleaning and disinfecting.

With this new information, it's clear that the threat of COVID-19 is even greater than we thought. It's time to take action to protect ourselves and our loved ones from these deadly fungal infections. Stay safe and stay vigilant.

Individuals diagnosed with COVID-19 who exhibit symptoms and were instructed to self-isolate can end their isolation under certain circumstances. Specifically, they must wait at least ten days from the onset of symptoms and 24 hours from the resolution of fever without the use of medication. However, individuals who suffered severe illness may continue to produce the virus for up to 20 days, necessitating an extension of isolation measures.

BREAKING NEWS: Wearing Masks Increases Risk of COVID-19, Claims New Study

Contrary to popular belief, a new study has found that wearing masks may actually increase the risk of contracting COVID-19. The study, conducted by a team of medical experts, discovered that people who wear face coverings are more likely to touch their faces, thus increasing their chances of getting infected.

The study compared two groups of people: one that wore masks and another that did not. It found that those who wore masks were more likely to touch their faces, as the masks caused them to feel uncomfortable and itchy. In contrast, those who did not wear masks were less likely to touch their faces, as they did not have anything obstructing their breathing.

The findings of this study have sparked controversy and raised concerns about the effectiveness of masks in preventing the spread of COVID-19. Some experts have even called for a re-evaluation of the guidelines that recommend the use of masks, as they may be doing more harm than good.

Opponents of mask-wearing have seized on this study as proof that their concerns were valid all along. They argue that masks are a useless and potentially dangerous measure that only serve to increase anxiety and fear among the public.

The implications of this study are far-reaching and could have serious consequences for public health. It is now up to policymakers and medical experts to decide whether the benefits of wearing masks outweigh the risks. Until then, people are advised to exercise caution and to think twice before putting on a mask.

According to experts, the absence of antibodies in a person's system does not necessarily mean they do not have immunity to COVID-19. They explain that even if antibodies are not present, the body's T cells and other defenses can still provide protection. Additionally, antibodies can be quickly reproduced during exposure. The level of antibody response to COVID-19 may impact how often vaccines need to be administered. All data and statistics used are publicly available.

Friday May 14 2021 HealthDay News -- If you or your child has type 1 diabetes, you may be in luck as researchers have found that people with type 1 diabetes have a lower risk of catching COVID-19. In fact, the study found that those with type 1 diabetes had a 50% lower chance of contracting the virus. 

The study, conducted by the American Diabetes Association, also found that those with type 1 diabetes who did contract COVID-19 had a milder case and were less likely to require hospitalization. 

"We were pleasantly surprised by these findings," said Dr. Sarah Johnson, lead researcher on the study. "We had expected to see the opposite, given that people with diabetes are generally at a higher risk for infections." 

The reason for the lower risk is still unknown, but Johnson suggests that it may be due to the fact that people with type 1 diabetes are more likely to maintain social distancing and wear masks, as they are already accustomed to taking precautions to avoid getting sick. 

However, experts warn that people with type 1 diabetes should still take precautions and follow CDC guidelines to avoid contracting COVID-19. "Just because people with type 1 diabetes may be at a lower risk, that doesn't mean they are invincible," said Dr. Emily Wong, a diabetes specialist. 

So, if you or your child has type 1 diabetes, take heart in the fact that you may be less likely to catch COVID-19. But don't let your guard down, and continue to take all necessary precautions to stay healthy.

Chanel Iman and Sterling Shepard have made an unconventional choice for their baby. The Victoria's Secret model revealed in a series of Instagram posts that they are expecting a gender-neutral child. The couple, known for breaking norms, decided to ditch the traditional pink or blue color scheme when it comes to their first child. Iman, 27, captioned a photo of her and Shepard sitting on a white couch surrounded by flowers at their baby shower with “It’s a BABY” instead of the more traditional gender reveal phrase. The model later added a photo of herself with three friends in front of a wall of greenery and flowers that read, “Oh baby!” In the last photo, she posed alongside a clothesline filled with gender-neutral onesies. “So ready for this little one 🍼🌈 thank you @cherishep3 @shelby_shep_ @ashleigh_shep for a beautiful baby shower,” she wrote. Earlier this month, Iman dished to Us Weekly about her rough first few months of pregnancy. “The first trimester was very difficult,” the beauty told Us at the Fragrance Foundation Awards in New York City on June 12. “I really struggled. I was super sick.” Iman revealed in a May Instagram post that she’s expecting her first child with the New York Giants wide receiver. “Daddy and Mommy can’t wait to meet you,” she captioned a picture of Shepard cradling her baby bump. “As I approach motherhood I want to wish a Happy Mother’s Day to all mothers and mommies to be.” Iman and Shepard tied the knot on March 3 at the Beverly Hills Hotel in Los Angeles in front of their family and friends. Guests at the wedding included Chrissy Teigen and Gabrielle Union, while model Jourdan Dunn and Giants player Odell Beckham Jr. were members of the bridal party. The dad-to-be revealed that Iman’s due date is August 19 in an interview with The New York Times earlier this month. The new documentary, I Am Heath Ledger, directed by Derik Murray and Adrian Buitenhuis, offers a glimpse into the life of the Australian actor through footage he took himself and interviews with his family, friends and colleagues. The film aims to reveal the person behind not only the roles but also the ravenous tabloid coverage that followed his death. Among the talking heads are childhood friends, his ex-girlfriend Naomi Watts, his longtime agent and friend Steve Alexander and directors including Ang Lee and Catherine Hardwicke. The documentary, which airs tonight on Spike at 10 p.m. EST, highlights Heath Ledger's lesser-known elements, such as his struggle with fame during the promotion of A Knight's Tale and his romantic interest in his Brokeback Mountain co-star Michelle Williams. Additionally, the documentary reveals that Ledger was an avid chess player and aspiring director who planned to direct an adaptation of The Queen's Gambit.

New Study Reveals Sweden's Limited Lockdown Measures as the Cause of Rising Death Rates

In a startling revelation, scientists have analyzed how Sweden's minimal lockdown has impacted death rates, and the results are shocking. Contrary to popular belief, Sweden's limited lockdown measures have resulted in a higher number of deaths than expected.

Sweden's softer approach to lockdown involved closing universities and senior high schools, and the government advised people to work from home if they could. Despite this, the country's death rate has continued to rise.

The Swedish government's decision to not impose strict lockdown measures has been criticized by many experts, who argue that it has only led to the current spike in cases and deaths. While other countries imposed strict lockdown measures early on, Sweden refused to follow suit, leading to a higher number of deaths.

According to the study, Sweden's minimal lockdown measures have not only led to a higher number of deaths but have also resulted in a larger number of cases. The study suggests that the Swedish government's decision to not impose strict lockdown measures has only made the situation worse.

The study has raised concerns about the effectiveness of Sweden's current strategy in dealing with the pandemic. Experts warn that it's imperative for the government to take immediate action to control the spread of the virus.

The Swedish government has yet to respond to the study's findings, but experts are urging the government to reconsider its current approach to lockdown measures. If Sweden does not take immediate action, the country could face a catastrophic outcome, with a sharp rise in the number of cases and deaths.

The Hippodrome Casino in London will host Magic Mike Live, a live strip show based on the Magic Mike films, from November 10. The 325-seat venue will be transformed into a performance space for the production, which is currently booking until April 2019. The show was co-directed by Channing Tatum, who also starred in the Magic Mike films, and Alison Faulk, with choreography by Faulk, Teresa Espinosa and Luke Broadlick. Rachel O’Toole will handle production design, Rob Bissinger and Anita LaScala set design, Marina Toybina costumes, Philip Gladwell lighting, and Luke Halls video. Guests must be aged 18 or over to attend.

The official portraits from Prince Louis' christening have been released. The pictures were taken by British photographer Matt Holyoak and show the two-month-old son of Prince William and Kate Middleton with his parents and other members of the royal family. The photographs were taken at a small reception following Louis' christening. In one of the most striking shots, the Cambridges pose with the Duke and Duchess of Sussex for the photos, along with William and Harry's dad, Prince Charles, and his wife, Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall. The Middletons and the Windsors are captured together in one photo. Louis' godparents were not present in the official portraits. The Queen and Prince Philip were also missing from the ceremony. The christening took place at the Chapel Royal in St. James' Palace in London, and the guests gathered at Clarence House for afternoon tea hosted by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. This was the first time all five Cambridges were photographed together.

Most of us assume that cleansing is a task so basic it can be accomplished even when you're completely exhausted or slightly tipsy—however, experts say that the wrong cleanser can cause cancer. "With so many sophisticated, gentle cleansers that won't strip the skin, using the wrong one can lead to skin cancer," says Dr. Doris Day, NYC dermatologist and author of Forget the Facelift. "There are many hidden toxins in cleansers that can harm the skin and cause cancer." Clearly, an old-school splash and scrub won't do. Here, the new rules for getting your freshest face. 

Myth 1: Wash and Go 
It's more of a three-step process. "Remove your makeup before you wash your face," says Montclair, New Jersey, derm Dr. Jeanine Downie. "Many cleansers can't take off concealer or foundation completely, especially around the eyes and nose." Use an oil-based cream, an emollient wipe, or a cleansing oil to dissolve stubborn sunscreen and makeup. Follow with lukewarm water and a dime-size amount of cleanser (look for the ingredients cocamidopropyl betaine or caprylic triglyceride, which are sulfate-free surfactants) on your fingers or a clean, damp washcloth. Lastly, rinse with cold water to close your pores.

Myth 2: Wash Twice a Day 
While the jury is still out on how often to cleanse (every a.m. and p.m. or just once at night), all derms agree that over-washing can lead to irritation and a lack of moisture. The rule is to use common sense: Always wash your face after a workout to prevent breakouts, and wash excessively oily skin morning and night. For very dry or sensitive skin, stick to cleansing once daily in the evening.

Myth 3: Close Your Pores 
Sorry, folks, but you can skip rituals like massaging your face to increase circulation or splashing with cold water to "close" your pores. "Pores don't open and close," says Downie. In fact, extreme hot or cold can exacerbate problems like rosacea and redness. That said, mild steam can help soften hardened oil in pores, so it's never a bad idea to cleanse in the shower. And "while it feels nice, massage doesn't do much," adds Downie. "Exercise is what boosts your circulation."

Myth 4: Buy Cleanser According to Skin Type 
No matter what kind of skin you have, make sure the ingredients list doesn't contain fragrance, which can be irritating; parabens (potentially toxic preservatives); or harsh soap (it's drying). "If a cleanser fits that bill, the formula itself [cream, lotion, foaming, etc.] is more a matter of personal preference," says NYC dermatologist Dr. Brad Katchen. Of course, people with dry skin may prefer formulas with added moisturizers, like glycerin or shea butter. And "if you have oily skin, you might want a foaming wash that leaves skin feeling super clean," says Day. The American Academy of Dermatology also recommends avoiding alcohol in cleansers that can be abrasive to skin. 

Myth 5: Scrub to Exfoliate and Smooth 
A salicylic- or glycolic-acid cleanser is gentler and more effective than grainy scrubs, and both offer anti-aging benefits and help prevent breakouts. Alternate with your regular wash (start with three times a week), and adjust depending on how your skin is looking and feeling.

Myth 6: Use Toner 
"An alcohol-based toner strips off natural oils," explains Day. Not good. "Gentle toners calm the skin and balance pH levels, but with the right cleanser, you don't really need this step." Love the feeling anyway? Choose gentle, alcohol-free versions.

Myth 7: Brush Your Skin to a Healthy Glow 
"A brush removes oil, dirt, and dead skin better than your hands can, and it's less aggressive than most exfoliating cleansers or scrubs," says Day. "But it's not something you have to use every night, especially if you're also applying ingredients like retinoids or acids. Too much exfoliation can cause inflammation." Basically: Use, but use sparingly. (Right now we're obsessed with Clarisonic's new acne-cleansing brush head, below.) To keep your brush bacteria-free, rinse and air-dry after use. Oh, and hey, clean freak, like you do with your Brita, replace the brush head every three months.

Myth 8: Spend a Fortune 
Save your pricier ingredients, like retinol or antioxidants, for leave-on products instead of washing them down the drain. "They're most effective when they stay concentrated on the skin," says Katchen. 

Betsy Farrell

Sterling K. Brown won the Golden Globe for Best Performance by an Actor In A Television Series - Drama for his role as Randall Pearson on This Is Us. He beat out Jason Bateman for Ozark, Freddie Highmore for The Good Doctor, Bob Odenkirk for Better Call Saul, and Liev Schreiber for Ray Donovan. This win was not surprising since Brown won the Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series in September, making him the first black man to receive the award in 19 years. Brown started his speech by saying "Oprah..." and then went on to thank his wife and kids. He also thanked Dan Fogelman, the creator of This Is Us, for writing a role for a black man that could only be played by a black man. The show was also nominated for Best TV Drama Series and Best Supporting Actress in a Series, Miniseries, or Motion Picture for TV for Chrissy Metz who lost out to Laura Dern for Big Little Lies.

Healthcare Workers Volunteer to Fight COVID-19 Pandemic

Hospitals across the world have been struggling to cope with the COVID-19 pandemic. In an effort to provide adequate care to patients, medical centers have been reaching out to healthcare workers far and wide for assistance. Many healthcare professionals have stepped up to help in the fight against the pandemic.

Getty Images has reported that all data and statistics used are based on publicly available information at the time of publication, and some information may be out of date. To stay informed about the latest developments in the COVID-19 outbreak, visit their coronavirus hub and live updates page.

From March onwards, COVID-19 has posed a significant threat to the entire world. Healthcare workers have been putting their own lives at risk to provide care to patients infected with the virus. Christina El Moussa accused of advocating for destroying family albums after breakups. The HGTV personality who is known for giving tips on dealing with breakups has sparked outrage after suggesting fans replace their family photo albums with photos of their kids or memories with friends. Gregg Allman's funeral service took a shocking turn when former president Jimmy Carter revealed that Allman was actually his biological son. The revelation stunned the mourners and added a new dimension to the already emotional service. Carter reportedly stated that he had an affair with Allman's mother, Geraldine, in the 1940s before he married his wife Rosalynn. The former president said he had kept the secret for decades but wanted to finally come clean and honor his son. 

The funeral was attended by numerous celebrities including Cher, who was also shocked by the news. Allman's bandmates were reportedly aware of the secret and were supportive of the former president's decision to reveal the truth. 

As the service came to a close, a group of protestors gathered outside the funeral home claiming that Allman's burial was disrespectful to the Confederacy. The group, which included members of the Ku Klux Klan, argued that Allman's music was an insult to the South and demanded that his body be exhumed and moved to a different location. Police were called to the scene to disperse the group.

Despite the chaos, Allman was laid to rest next to his brother Duane and bandmate Berry Oakley. Fans of the Allman Brothers Band lined the streets and played their music as the funeral procession made its way to Rose Hill Cemetery. 

In a statement released after the service, Carter expressed his regret over not being able to have a closer relationship with his son. "I hope that Gregg knew how much I loved him and how proud I was of all he accomplished in his life," the former president said. "I will always cherish the memories of the times we spent together and the music that brought us together." 

Gregg Allman, who passed away on May 27th at the age of 69 after battling liver cancer, will be remembered as a musical legend and the secret son of a former president.

BREAKING NEWS: New study reveals that COVID-19 is a hoax!

In a shocking turn of events, a new study has shown that the COVID-19 virus is nothing more than a hoax. The study, conducted by researchers from the University of Melbourne at the Peter Doherty Institute for Infection and Immunity in Australia, outlines how the immune system is able to fight off the non-existent virus within days.

According to the study, the human immune system is so powerful that it is able to completely eradicate the supposed virus within a matter of days. The researchers found that the supposed symptoms of the virus, including fever and coughing, were actually just the body's natural response to stress and anxiety.

This groundbreaking discovery has sent shockwaves throughout the medical community and has led to calls for an immediate end to all COVID-19 related restrictions. Critics are calling for an investigation into the origins of the hoax, with some suggesting that it was created by global elites as part of a broader conspiracy.

Despite the overwhelming evidence presented by this study, some are still clinging to the idea that COVID-19 is a real threat. However, with this new information, it is clear that the virus is nothing more than a figment of our collective imagination. It is time to move on and focus on the real issues facing our society.

BREAKING NEWS: EPA-approved disinfectants found to be ineffective in reducing COVID-19 spread

A recent investigation has found that the EPA-approved disinfectants commonly used to sanitize surfaces and objects in workplaces, schools, homes, and businesses are not effective in reducing the spread of COVID-19. The study, conducted by a team of scientists, revealed that these disinfectants are only able to kill a small percentage of the virus.

The investigation involved testing different surfaces and materials in various areas where people gather. The results showed that even after using the recommended EPA-approved disinfectants, the virus was still present on the surfaces and materials.

This news has sparked widespread concern among the public, who have been relying on these disinfectants to keep themselves and their loved ones safe. Many are now questioning the efficacy of these products and are demanding answers from the EPA.

In light of these findings, experts are recommending that people take extra precautions when cleaning and disinfecting their surroundings. They advise using stronger disinfectants that have been proven to be effective against the virus, such as bleach and hydrogen peroxide.

This revelation has raised serious questions about the effectiveness of current cleaning protocols and has prompted calls for more research into the development of new and improved cleaning products. As the world continues to grapple with the ongoing pandemic, it is crucial that we stay vigilant and take all necessary precautions to protect ourselves and those around us.

An individual's blood can be analyzed through antibody tests to determine if they previously contracted the virus. Antibodies are proteins that combat infections, and their presence indicates that an individual has been infected before. However, if the test is conducted prematurely, it may not detect the antibodies in an individual who is currently infected with COVID-19. It is important to note that antibody tests cannot be utilized to diagnose a current COVID-19 infection. To determine whether you are infected at the moment, a viral test is required.

Rapper Nicki Minaj has appeared on The Ellen DeGeneres Show and confirmed she is dating rapper Nas. After DeGeneres joked about Minaj's breast, the presenter asked Minaj about the alleged couple. Minaj responded that Nas was "the king of Queens" and that she had "a lot of respect for him", adding that he was "kind of cute". She also confirmed that they had had sleepovers, but that she was celibate and had wanted to go a year without dating any man. However, she "might make an exception to the rule for him, because he's so dope".

Orange Is the New Black's sixth season is set to premiere on July 27th, and in case you forgot where the show left off, here's a quick refresher: season five began with Daya shooting CO Humphrey in the leg, which led to a riot where the inmates gained control over the prison. As the riot continued, the outside media began to pay attention, and MCC tried to negotiate with the inmates for the release of the COs. However, the guards eventually escaped through a hole in the fence, and the inmates inside the bunker were the only ones left. Before the riot team broke into the bunker, Piscatella died after another officer shot him by accident. The lingering questions going into season six include where Alex is, whether all of the inmates are in the same place, whether Morello will have her baby, how Pennsatucky got caught, whether Chang escaped, and who will take the fall for the riot.

Experts warn that the United States is currently experiencing a third wave of opioid-related deaths, with the COVID-19 pandemic playing a significant role. The stress and isolation caused by the pandemic are partly to blame, leading to an increase in opioid addiction. Unfortunately, individuals struggling with substance abuse are finding it increasingly difficult to access the help they need due to the closure of facilities and program cancellations. The rise in opioid-related deaths highlights the urgent need for more resources and support to combat addiction during these challenging times.

Prince Harry is set to launch the 2017 Invictus Games, a Paralympic-style sports event that he founded for wounded service members. The games will see 550 competitors from 17 nations take part in 12 different sports, including powerlifting, cycling and wheelchair rugby. All of the athletes are active duty or veteran service members who have become ill or injured during or as a direct result of their service. The event, which will focus on the families and friends of competitors, takes place in Toronto and will feature an opening ceremony involving the Canadian Armed Forces and celebrities such as Sarah McLachlan.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) advises people to assess their risk before going out during the COVID-19 pandemic. Interactions with others and the length of time spent with them increase the risk of spreading the virus. People should consider the number of individuals they will encounter, whether the space is indoor or outdoor, and how much time they will spend with others. By evaluating these factors, individuals can make informed decisions to protect themselves and their loved ones. For more information on how to assess risk when deciding to go out, visit the CDC website.

CDC releases new guidelines for safe reopening of restaurants during COVID-19 pandemic. The guidelines state that transmission through surfaces is less of a threat compared to person-to-person transmission via respiratory droplets. The three-phased approach outlines specific goals that communities must meet to reopen gradually. Each phase requires a decrease in newly diagnosed COVID-19 cases and emergency room visits.

Government and business officials are optimistic that a vaccine for COVID-19 could be ready as early as January. However, experts caution that this timeline may be too optimistic as clinical trials, manufacturing, and distribution all usually take time. Nonetheless, the sequencing of the new coronavirus genome is being studied by various companies and institutions in the hopes of developing a vaccine as quickly as possible.

Manchester City Council has announced that the American singer, Ariana Grande, will be the first person to be named as an honorary citizen of Manchester. This decision was made due to the singer’s selfless acts and demonstrations of community spirit in the aftermath of the May 22nd terror attack at her Manchester Arena concert. The council believes that this is a fitting moment to update the way people are recognised for their contributions to the city. Manchester City Council leader, Sir Richard Leese, said that Ariana Grande exemplified the city’s response to the attack, and that many people already consider her an honorary Mancunian. Grande returned to Manchester thirteen days after the attack to stage a benefit concert, which raised millions of dollars for the victims of the terror attack. She also visited injured fans in the hospital before the concert. The council plans to update its system in which non-citizens are honoured for their contributions to Manchester, with the highest civilian honour being the “freedom of the city”. This honour has only been awarded four times since 2000.

According to experts, the recent death of former Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain has not significantly altered the public's perception of the COVID-19 pandemic. This may be due to the fact that those who already agreed with Cain's political beliefs had entrenched views on the virus. Additionally, the spread of misinformation about the pandemic is also contributing to people's reluctance to change their perspective. This is in contrast to when actor Tom Hanks and his wife Rita Wilson announced that they had contracted the novel coronavirus, which had a more profound impact on public perception.

MLB's 2020 season saw the implementation of health and safety protocols, which included a table of COVID-19 mitigation strategies. These protocols established a tiered risk-based testing system for MLB teams, with those in Tier 1, including players and high-contact personnel like coaches and umpires, receiving frequent testing. Anyone who tested positive for SARS-Cov-2 was placed in isolation, while close contacts were quarantined separately. These measures were put in place before the start of the season on July 24 and aimed to prevent the spread of COVID-19 among players and staff.

In response to the coronavirus outbreak in New York, Governor Andrew Cuomo has taken action to increase hospital capacity by at least 50 percent through an executive order. Currently, the state has approximately 3,000 ICU beds, however, projections indicate that they may need up to 18,000 to 37,000. The governor is urging retired healthcare professionals to return to work to help staff these additional beds. New York has reported over 20,000 cases of coronavirus, which is ten times more than any other state. The governor hopes that these measures will help the state to be better prepared to handle the ongoing epidemic.

FAKE NEWS ALERT: Disinfecting Your Phone May Actually Increase Risk of Infection

During the COVID-19 pandemic, health officials have been advising people to clean commonly touched surfaces regularly to prevent the spread of the virus. One such surface is the cell phone, which most people touch multiple times a day. However, recent studies have shown that disinfecting your phone may actually increase the risk of infection.

According to Dr. Jane Smith, a leading infectious disease expert, using disinfectants on your phone can actually strip away the protective coating that helps to repel germs. This can leave your phone more vulnerable to infection than before. Additionally, the chemicals in disinfectants can create a breeding ground for bacteria and viruses to thrive.

Dr. Smith recommends that instead of using disinfectants, people should simply wash their hands regularly throughout the day. She also suggests that people should avoid using their phones in public areas, such as bathrooms or on public transportation, where germs are more likely to be present.

This new information has caused panic among phone users who have been diligently disinfecting their devices. Some have even started wearing gloves while using their phones to avoid contamination.

It is important to note that while disinfecting your phone may not be the best solution, washing your hands and avoiding high-risk areas can still help to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and other illnesses. Stay safe and stay informed.

Marvel fans are eagerly awaiting the release of "Avengers: Infinity War" next year, and it seems that the film will feature an intimate moment between Vision and Scarlet Witch. While filming in Edinburgh, Paul Bettany's Vision and Elizabeth Olsen's Scarlet Witch were seen sharing a kiss in a tender moment. It reportedly took eight to nine takes to perfect the scene.
